description:
Came here for a late lunch when we heard they have $1 oysters. They were the only spot on the area to have the deal, and apparently it's all the time. 
They have a nice selection of beer, and I was able to try a few local breweries. 
I had an order of the chicken wings and they were good. Crispy, little kick. My girlfriend got the oysters, and she enjoyed those. 
They had a pool table and pinball machine too.
author: John M.

description:
Beer is good. Bar tenders suck! They ignore you and are very rude when they talk.  Had horrible attitudes.  I took my friend from Germany to San Francisco to the pier etc. we stopped in here and had the worst service. I had to take him elsewhere to reassure him there are nice people in the service biz in San Fran. This place gives off a bad vibe to tourists. Please do not waste your time in the city by going here. The bathrooms are also dirty and the hand blower did not work.  This is not the way you should experience the city that has so many great things to offer to have a experience to remember in positive way.  Again the bartenders are very rude and bathroom is horrible.  Please do not go here.  There is no reason anyone should deal with rude people that mess it up for you and others that come
To visit our city.  

Thank you
author: Jack C.

description:
This is a divey touristy pub just off the tourist madness that is fishermans wharf.

Parking can be tricky, due to the super popular destinations close by (Fisherman's wharf, maritime park, powell and mason cablecar line, historical hyde pier, Ghirardelli square, pier 39 etc.). There are some pay lots and garages scattered around, but like a lot of things in this city you will be best served by getting here some way that does not involve driving.

This is a gigantic space. The entrance is make by a life size or slightly larger wooden carved bear, and the restrooms are close by the entrance, clean (usually. Late at night around closing they get more problematical.), they serve food, the bar service is quick (again usually. On a dense pack game night with one bartender out things can get sticky), and there is often live music which will make up for whatever inadequacy in skill and tone with volume. There is seating enough for just about any size group with no waiting, the main bar has room for twenty ish on almost comfortable stools, and on packed nights there will be a smaller auxiliary bar opening up towards the front in an effort to get you liquor quicker. The overall theme is of the dark cave like dive bar motif.

The crowd can be eclectic ish. A lot of touristy passer by, a smaller amount of blue collar folk drinking their pay, and even some local peeps. The tap wall is a reasonable mix os mass market brands (coors) macro brews (sam adams, sierra nevada) and local/regional beers (anchor steam for the win!). The wine selection isn't any too deep, yet offers some good verging on great choices. This is a full service bar with wide (in variety if not premium) selection of spirit's. Whatever your tasty adult beverage of choice is (applejack, beer, brandy, slivovitz, whisky in a jar, red red wine and so much more) they are likely t have some version of it. Pricing can be more then you'd expect/want however. Six dollars a pint is on the low end of things, and yes you can get into the twelve dollar a beer range. 

The food will run twenty ish a plate on the low side-although the apps can be a bit less. The menu isn't too ambitious-eggs, burgers, steak, soups and salads. Standard American pub fare. They can do vegetarian versions of everything but the steak. It's really too easy to get into the forty-fifty ish dollar range for a meal and a drink which....well, I dunno if you like the place and have a great time that's all well and good but it can seem more money then value a lot of the time, especially as the food falls decisively into  the good but not great category.  Service is okay. It's quick if at times indifferent at the main bar, but in the dining area you may have uncomfortable periods of isolation if they are understaffed-and they almost always are.

Overall it's not bad-it can be reasonably painless to get in/out of but the overly loud music, steep city pricing, and indifferent food make this a solid three stars.
author: Steven W.

description:
CLOSED?!?! 
Was trying to come here for some $1 oysters on our way to dinner. Used to be a fun place for drinks and simple food that I visited twice as a tourist and recently moved nearby and discovered outdoor seating. Whatever moves in is gonna be $$$
author: New2Northbeach N.

description: Jack's is tucked in off of Fisherman's Warf.  Tourists pass right by it.  It's located in the Del Monte Cannery, and has a beautiful interior.  I enjoyed tasty $1.00 Oysters, some fries, and a Irish coffee. Don't judge the combo. It worked.  Lol.  Bonus to this bar is the photo booth, pinball game,  and did I mention the interior? Love this spot.  Cash is king. No plastic taken.
author: Victoria C.

description: I refuse to accept that Jack's is closed for business. What a huge loss for the wharf and for the city as a whole. It was one of the city's treasures. I'll miss the amazing staff the most for they were the ones who made Jack's such a magical place. May the spirit of Jack's Cannery Bar live on forever.
author: Kalea K.

description: Drinks are good oysters are terrible. They dont know how to open them shells all up in them
author: Reubn L.

description:
I wandered into Jack's en route to San Francisco Brewing Co., down the street at Ghirardelli Square.  I had no idea Jack's was still open!  I came in here fairly often thirty years ago while living in the city, but somehow or other they've sort of fallen off my radar.  


Anyway, pretty much as I remember:  a big, rather dark room, with two bars (there used to be a third upstairs), pool tables, and lots of brewery miscellanea--also a small display of Studebaker memorabilia, including models and a complete dashboard from a '57 Golden Hawk.  Not surprisingly given the location, the clientele appears to include a heavy mix of tourists.

About 47 craft brews on draft, in the $6-$8 range; also miscellaneous industrial beers and bottles.  I had time for only one:

- Devil's Canyon Deadicated (sic) Amber Ale.  5.4% ABV.  Clear red-brown, light head.  Taste is caramel malt, modestly bittered with Cascade.


One thing left a bad impression:  I gave the bartender a $20, and initially was only given change for a $10.  Of course she made it up when I pointed out the error.  Deliberate attempt at short-changing?  Oh, who can say?  I prefer to think the best of people.
author: Alan F.

description:
Review based on the bar. We came Friday evening and here was live music and all of the games were on. Of course the only downfall is cash only bar, but there is an atm inside. 

Please note there is a 40 beer limit strictly enforced
author: Nicole G.

description: The place is at a nice spot. Ordered oyster and chicken tenders here which were pretty good. The person who was playing guitar was really good and was well skilled( some observations from a fellow guitarist ;). This place is a cash only so keep that in mind before going
author: Sharad B.

description:
Wow came here on a Friday night, and not was it packed. There was only one table left where we went and seated ourselves. It was in a corner blocked by another table so that the poor patrons who sat there had to get up every time a server tried to help us.
Also, as packed as it was, it almost seemed like there was only one guy working there and he was constantly working two different bars. 
We ordered two martinis and wow were they ridiculously small. I didn't even know they made martini glasses so small.
We did just come here for the $1 oysters, and they were delicious. It is a shame that we could only make one order because it was just a chore trying to get the one guy to take our order. I would love to come back to have some more oysters here, but definitely not when it is that packed.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
what a hole in the wall, service ok
food terrible, manager looks homeless
drinks terrible over priced,
author: Gregory M.

description: I like, I like, I like. Cool bar, great afternoon vibe. Beer list goes on for miles. With all the cool stuff hanging on the walls you could see something new every time you went. I want this bar in my house.
author: Dave F.

description: We went here because they always advertise their 1 dollar oysters which is not too bad.  But you get an assortment of small and large ones.  Some can be sandy as well.  You get crackers as well with the sauce and horseradish. Service was just okay as there was 1 worker working and it is a sit yourself, but you have to figure that part out and took some time to take our order as we went to the bartender to ask how to order..  You can also sit outside and there are more servers as well. The bathroom did smell like pot in there which was the downside.
author: Keven W.

description: Cool little Dive Bar in San Francisco I'm giving this place 4 out of 5 stars because they had a dude up there singing some live music at a happy hour that I got probably six Miller High Life $2 a piece and a draft IPA for $5 that was a dollar off. The only reason why I didn't give us a 5 out of 5 stars is the bartender that waited on me wasn't very nice and they only take cash which they really sucks because they'll carries around cash till? So four out of five stars
author: Jeremy J.

description: Worst time ive came, just sat down for 25 minutes and not even an talked to by a host or server. But they walked by us plenty of times. We just left instead of dealing with more incompetent employees
author: Nikolai P.

description: Tourists listen to me... Go elsewhere. I am saving you valuable time and frustration in your day. Worst non service I ever received. Waited for 40 minutes with food order that never came on a near empty patio. Watching other guests get up to get their own menus was laughable. Just ended leaving this low brow cash only establishment. An embarrassment of service.
author: Joe S.

description: Horrific experience. We waited 30 mins for NO food before we had to be somewhere after getting promised we could be in and out in 30 mins then the guy was terribly rude to us when we said we had to go (bc we were catching a boat) and said to us instead of apologizing this isn't a fast food place!!!!! It was so unbelievably rude!!!!! We are starving and now ah e to go on a tour w no food because of this unprepared unstaffed establishment. Also it's cash only which is inconvenient. The service was horrific!!! All the tables patrons were getting up from their seats asking for napkins, lemons, menus.... there was a line standing bc there was horrific service - we waited all that time so that someone could be rude to us!!!!!!!! Do not. Go there!!!!!!
author: Alana O.

description: BEST beer bar and drink bar! Dollar oysters won me over. Michelle our bartender was the best! Great beer selection and nice big mixed drinks. They have a food menu too but I went for the juicy oysters. A bargain anywhere, especially in San Francisco!
author: Denise W.

description:
I have to admit that I enjoyed myself at this bar.

The main draw was the guy playing guitar and singing up at the front of the bar. He was playing all sorts of greats songs from the 70s and 80s and he had not only a wonderful voice but was a mean guitar player too.

We were able to get a table and when we ordered drinks, not too many people were around so we didn't have to wait that much. But as soon as the crowds started to fill in, it was very difficult to get a drink order in and it just seemed like too much confusion around. My aunt ordered some oysters but didn't seem too happy for them.

I only came here because my relatives wanted a sports bar to check out some playoff games in Fisherman's Wharf, otherwise I really wouldn't be around here. But if you come here, definitely come for the live music and come preferably without a huge crowd around.
author: Art O.

description:
Is a year and a bit ago too long to put off a review? I thought I wrote one but only realized I didn't when I was looking for the name of this place.

So, I came here because I took a random cable car ride, wound up at Fisherman's Wharf, and looked for the least tourist trap looking place I found. I think it was oysters that caught my attention, and the massive selection of beer.

I don't know why it wouldn't get good reviews, the staff were friendly, the beer selection was awesome. In fact, the only thing I have to complain about is that it's cash only, and that always drives me nuts - especially travelling in a foreign country where I'm trying to carry as little cash as I can. Nevertheless, it was still a great spot.
author: Nick B.

description: It took 20 minutes to get a bottled beer because there was only 1 bartender 'making our drink'. It took over an hour to get our burgers. They refused to have the cooks turn down their music that was competing with the other music. They said if we didn't like it, we could move. The hamburger was very good but not worth the surly, unfriendly, unhelpful staff & ridiculously slow service. It's cash only too with a handy ATM that costs $3.50+ per transaction inside the bar.
author: Martha C.

description: If you're looking for good beer and selection this is the place! They have just about every kind of beer you can think of! The food wasn't the greatest but is expected when going to a bar. One thing I do like about this place is that it's not as crowded as all the other bars in the area and it's located right at the wharf! I'll come back for sure and will recommend this place to people.
author: Cameron L.

description: Awesome atmosphere but bartender we had was extremely rude, asked her about what stouts they had and she told us to read the list that she wasnt going to read it for us. (There were only 2 stouts on the list that she just couldn't read apparently) she was not helpful at all. We came in friday at 1:35pm not sure what her name was.
author: Denise L.

description:
Not quite sure why anyone would complain about this place.  Have been in SF for a ten day vacation, and keep finding myself here.  Bar is clean, bartenders have been courteous  but not overbearing, they have live music and over 60 beers on tap.  Restrooms are more then acceptable.   Prices are fair, especially for being by the pier and the food was fine as well.

     The fact that they only take cash is really a non issue in my book.  Been to over 20 bars during my stay here and 75% were cash only.  Quit your whining and stuff $30 in your shoe.  That's enough to get a meal and some beers here, or, skip the meal, try some different brews and get your jag on.  

     Will recommend Jacks to any friends or family I have that visit the bay area!
author: James D.

description:
A nice place to unwind. 

Jack's is a good ol place to kickback with a cool drink, listening to some music and munching on fried up seafood. $1 oysters is also one of the best deals you can get in the Bay Area. 

Jack's boasts a huge selection of beers on tap and decorate their bar with tap handles from years of serving beer giving it a timeless feel. The decor is a mix of classy wood carvings and crude bar humor. The mix of arcade machines and photo booths make the bar feel a little too modern compared to the other decor, and it invites children to come in and play, which I could do without in a bar. 

Service was slow, but considering we saw one server in the whole establishment, it's understand
author: Nadav P.

description: Great drinks, but the bathrooms!! No paper towels and the driers don't work and there wasn't any hand soap.  Sad. Been here before and everything was amazing,  bummer.
author: Stacie J.

description:
steak was amazing delicious  
clam chowder taste like potatoes soup it was yuk!! 
waiter service was nice ...
he laughed at some of my stupid comments. 
which is a plus...
author: DiamondLee R.

description: Third time coming here since 2008, and I have to say that the place is still good! We ordered burgers, chicken tenders, and fries, and everything was great - tasted delicious, fresh and was warm! The one thing I didn't remember was about this being a cash only restaurant... thankfully we had cash on us. They do have an ATM but I'm sure anyone would try to avoid those fees! Overall, good experience!
author: G F.

description:
CASH ONLY

but... $1 OYSTERS!

I'm Vietnamese and I still can't get used to establishments being cash only, but I REALLY like this bar. It looks like a bigger than average dive bar, but instead of your daily local drunks, it's your random tourists. Bartender was nice and witty too - the type that has those sharp comebacks if you throw a joke at her. 

They have plenty of beers on tap including local San Francisco beers. If you're going to get food, definitely get the oysters and Jack's crab sandwich. It's super simple -  white bread, tomato, cheese, and A LOT of crab.

They also have live music here. Thumbs up from me!
author: Nancy T.

description: We were drawn in by the sign touting cheap oysters and happy hour, and what we unexpectedly found was a great little dive bar! The three of us visited during the late afternoon and spent an hour just relaxing. It's a safe environment for three female out-of-towners, which I appreciated. While Jack's is a dive bar, and one that is lined with dark wood paneling and has that "musty" charm, it's not one of those creepy dive bars -- it's accessible to everybody. Lots of local craft beers on tap and fresh oysters (while I was afraid that this may be a sketchy place to eat fresh oysters, we had zero tummy troubles afterward). The oysters were large and meaty and really did set us back only $1 each. If you're a cola drinker like me, note that they also have a selection of local soda on tap too! (The diet one is really tasty).
author: Louisa M.

description:
Have put this off too long.

Nice place, good beer, decent food, mostly friendly folk (the cooks "singing" along with the 70s rock is a fan favorite), but one experience overshadowed all that.

Bartender calls "last call" and goes down the bar filling orders.  Guy next to me is ignored.  Bartender goes to the end of the bar and wanders back, his work seemingly done.  Guy next to me asks politely for another beer.  Bartender says he missed last call.  Guy says he asked...bartender says no, cos the guy "is a filthy Australian and all Australian men beat their women."  

Guy says "you're joking."  Bartender then goes into a prolonged rant about the truth of his claim.  When I said something in defense of the bewildered Aussie, I had a pint glass thrown down on the bar in front of me, shattering the glass, leaving a chunk about 3" long spinning on the bar in front of me.

My new Aussie best friend is calm, not the least confrontational - upset by this unprovoked BS attack - but is repeatedly threatened by this clearly not entirely sane bartender.

So.  This is The City.  We're better than this jackass.
author: Pete G.

description: Live music, good drinks and friendly bar staff. Had a few drinks at the bar and talked with other customers. The guy singing was good so i stayed longer for more drinks. Was not crowed.
author: Tia T.

description: Went to The San Francisco Bay to treat the wife to a nice anniversary day went the wharf and had a great day this is were we had our first date 24 years ago so of course we had to eat at one of the same restaurants and this is where we had lunch that day. The place looks the same as it did back then a Lil more tourist then I remembered had live music still had nice meal had to remember it was bar food but still very good our server was great. The whole day was great
author: Ernest M.

description:
No frills food, but super reasonable and tasty.

I work in the area and they have the best, by far, steak fries and burgers. 

I didn't give them 5 stars because they only take cash, which is not the most convenient.
author: Jessica D.

description: I've only two experiences at Jack's Cannery and they're both two thumbs up. The decor and ambience are welcoming and intriguing and are full of stories, so ask the bartender or server, and you'll hear the history if there's time in their busy pub. Food has been fantastic at Jack's and so is the beer selection. Our servers and bartenders have been knowledgeable and provided guidance when ordering.
author: Sheryl G.

description:
Was in the area and heard some good tunes drifting outside, so ventured into Jacks Cannery.

It was pretty crowded, but most people were here watching sports on one of the many tvs.  However, in one corner was a smaller bar with a couple seats and an Irish musician and his guitar.

Sat at the bar and they have a huge selection of beers,  I settled on a cider.  The tunes were great and we ended up having another round.  One couple hopped up and began dancing,

Once the music ended, it was time for me to move on.  Either way a good spot to escape Fisherman's Wharf and catch a music act and beer.
author: Melissa L.

description: We were in town visiting and decided to take a stroll. We came across the outdoor patio area and decided to give it a try. Turned out they only accepted cash (seriously in this day and age). So to get moving on, the Food was very slow to come out... only had a dozen oysters and French fries... oysters were ready and on the table about 20 min in and about 15 minutes later the fries came out but weren't correct, waitress got the order wrong. We requested steak fries and got shoe string fries. It didn't seem to be to busy on the patio either at the time. Maybe an off day or maybe not. But our experience was not great which is why I gave a 2 star review. 1 star for the $1 oysters and 1 star for the good beer (FYI the service was NOT slow to provide and collect the tab lol [and itnot near closing hours either])
author: Andrew R.

description: It's a cool little place; but bartender working today was absolutely horrible at her job!  I would fire her immediately! We ask for recommendations on beers she wouldn't give us any! we asked which ones were Stouts and she said I'm not going to read the menu to you!!!  Little did we know there were only two! Not sure of her name... but she look like a witch with dark brown hair. Time was 1:35 Fri the 5th of July!
author: Lorraine G.

description:
Nice little bar near the wharf. A multitude of beer selections available. Great atmosphere and nice staff. 

Came here and enjoyed The Allagash White, was really good.
author: B R.

description:
This place was nice.

Ordered a couple of beers and enjoyed myself. Great location and plenty of beers on tap.

I would recommend this place!
author: Jeremiah B.

description:
We dropped in here for a beer, in search of some West coast options we can't get back home. This place has them! Tons of beers on tap. The bar is cash only. People seemed satisfied with their food, but we did not order any. They had live music which was pretty good too!

Minus 3 stars because they started staining the bar in the middle of the afternoon! What the heck is that? The fumes were strong. Everyone was taking notice. It would easily make a person dizzy or nauseous. We moved away from the bar to put some distance between us, but we found it extremely inappropriate to be doing. The one guy even left a paint brush on the bar near us! I felt like some health code violations happened here. I wouldn't come back just based on this experience.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
Buck a shuck oysters! Beers are $6 on happy hour, which is a fair price in this part of town. Great ambiance, and a nice break from tourist land which dominates the wharf. 

Sitting here on a Thursday afternoon and they've had great live music the whole time. Found this place last time we were in frisco, and glad we came back again for more oysters and brew!
author: Darcy W.

description: Had to try the buck a shuck oysters and the Bloody Mary. I heard the staff were unfriendly but my experience was that they were attentive and friendly. The oysters were ok....not the best I've had but for $1 each.....I'm not complaining...and the Bloody Mary was delicious! I went during happy hour and thought that the price would be cheaper but the Bloody Mary cost $10....so a little pricey but still very tasty.
author: Marwin D.

description:
Third time in SF, just walked by this place, saw they had 68 taps and decided to stop in.

BEST BURGER, $6!!!! 

Would recommend to anyone looking for a quick burg and brew.
author: Miguel L.

description:
Happy I stopped in this classic watering hole. 

Tons of beers on tap... Upwards of 60, and probably more than that. They have many staples but also some rotating taps. 

This place is CASH ONLY, so be mindful of that. Because of that, you also can't start a tab, so it's pay-as-you-go. (Note: might be different for regulars?)

There was live music going on on a Saturday afternoon. Nice courtyard bar that would be nice for the warmer weather.
author: Kristin Leigh M.

description: Can't speak to the drinks because the bartender was too rude to even acknowledge our existence. Sat there for several minutes on a pretty slow weeknight while he was busy chatting with some other customers. Even had someone come up behind us and ask him for a lighter, which he promptly handed to him over us, all while completely ignoring us.
author: Lindsey O.

description: A decent spot with a lengthy beer list. We enjoyed a couple of local beers and watching City thump Tottenham. Not sure what time they open on match days, but a good place to watch the Premier League
author: S R.

description:
We went here for the early football games.  The bar was nice.  It was a good environment for sporting events I imagine except for the live music being played later in the day.  The bartenders were all nice and attentive.  

I ordered the double cheeseburger with a side of fries ($9??).  The burger came with onions, lettuce, pickles, and a tomato.  They did not ask how I wanted the burger to be cooked so I expected the burger to come out cooked medium, but I was disappointed when it came out cooked to a medium well.  The meat seemed to be of solid quality, but it was just overcooked to my liking.  The bread did not add or subtract anything from my thoughts of the burger.  The fries were the thick kind.  They were not very flavorful at all.  

Will I go back?  Yeah, possibly.
author: Dan M.

description: Great for a laid back time. We went for happy hour from 3-7, I believe. It includes $2 bottled Miller high life or $1 off drinks. We also got bloody Mary's and Red Trolly Ale. Both were exceptional. I believe they have oyster specials then too, tho we did not partake. Nice friendly atmosphere and great live music. Would definitely recommend.
author: Danielle C.

description: 0 stars. Sat the for like 15 minutes. No service... no wait staff asked for order so left...
author: Mina R.

description:
We were staying next door, were tired and just wanted to sit somewhere outside and have a drink.   

There were a few people at the outdoor bar and one table was occupied.  We waited for at least ten minutes before a bartender showed up and told us we could sit anywhere.  Every outdoor table was sticky.   My Manhattan was OK as was my husband's local draft beer, but the bartender seemed a bit clueless and kept disappearing for long stretches of time.   

I'd look for the next closest outdoor bar and give this one a pass.
author: Karen S.

description: F*** yeah! This place is awesome! $1.00 raw oysters and a ton of draft beer to choose from. This place is inexpensive and totally laid back. I'm glad we were able to swing by here on our trip. This a definitely must go-to if you're looking for a break or even just a cool spot to relax, drink and have a little snack.
author: Mike Y.

description:
I worked directly above Jack's for the first year I lived in SF.  I notice a lot of hating on Yelp, and I'll grant you that I haven't tried the food.  But, there are a lot of good qualities about this place.  I could go to 3-Stars as a local, but in the context of Fisherman's Wharf, I think it goes to 4.  

The Good:
*68 Beers on Draft
*Cool space.  There's a main bar, a side bar, separate area of tables, and they have an outdoor patio/bar.  
*Live Music
*Long Hours - Opens at 7am
*Usually interesting tourists to chat up, many of them Euros.
*$1 Oysters
*Cool Location in The Cannery - Right next to Aquatic Park
*Food - Both Breakfast and Lunch/Dinner
*Solid Bartenders - Always good in my Book

The Bad:
*Of the 68 Beers on Draft, there aren't a ton of stand-outs if you're a seasoned Local Beer Drinker.  If you're on Vacay, you'll get plenty of West Coast offerings.
*Wharf Prices - $7 for a Lagunitas Lil' Sumpin.  (BTW - That I order this shows there isn't a ton off novelty to the menu.)
*One of the two TV's at the Main Bar is clearly not in great shape, which makes me wonder about standards.
*Bad Cell Reception.  Come on, some of us have Yelping to attend to.  
*Cash Only

If you hate The Wharf, this place probably won't make you a convert.  However, this isn't a Pier 39 "Why would you come to SF and do this?" type experience.  I enjoy the atmosphere down here, particularly now that I don't work here every day.  It's fun to meet tourists, and it's pretty by The Bay.  My opinion may change if I tried the food.  

If you are a tourist, particularly if you're down here with your family and need a few minutes to "re-group", you'll probably enjoy a visit while you give the kids the plastic so they can go buy an "I got Crabs in SF" t-shirt.  (I saw a 6/7 year old wearing one - Stay classy, Mom and Dad.  Although, I always wonder if someone buys it and doesn't understand the deeper meaning.)  I would probably recommend a number of other places nearby for lunch/dinner before this spot if you're visiting.
author: Adam S.

description: Love the atmosphere and service. But I just only had a beer and that worked out just fine.
author: Andrew C.

description:
This place has a nice friendly atmosphere. The man who was serving our food and refilling our cups was friendly and stopped multiple times to fill our cups. 

The food was great and the fries were also good. The prices compared to the rest of the food places seems fair. 

My only complaint would be that they only take cash (at the time being it could change) and the wait for the food was a bit long but overall it was a good experience. I would definitely come here again.
author: William A.

description: 01-14-18, the wife and I stopped in for a Bloody Mary.  Love this place for the service, atmosphere, sports on T.V. and the awesome burgers.  Highly recommend grabbing your favorite beverage here if your in the wharf area.
author: Jacky P.

description: Visited here during Fleet Week 2016, loved it!  Great choice of beers, crowded, but the servers were very attentive.  Found a seat every time we visited.  They played the Cubs vs San Francisco games and we had a great time!  Wish I was there this week to see the Navy Blue Angels and grab a drink!
author: Denise M.

description: Had a great time here last night with my husband and our friends.  Love the vast choice of draft beers!  It took a long time for our food to come out, so the waiter gave us a free round - very cool of him!  We come here monthly with our dog and eat outside on the patio, so it was a change to sit inside.  Plenty of space and a friendly vibe where we could chill and talk.
author: Casey E.

description: Really liked this place! Took my son here on his 21st birthday and loved all the beer on tap choices! We all enjoyed our drinks and the bartenders were cool as hell! The ambience was positive, lots of happy people, and there was good music playing! Had a great experience and would recommend this place to anyone visiting Pier 39!
author: Audrey N.

description: Hello dolla oysters with Bloody Mary; Jameson-iced coffee, try out this great combo! Good prices...what a fun place with live band and jukebox. Great bartenders! Huge place with lots of seatings. I luv it!!
author: Vee V.

description:
Absolute garbage cocktails. An old fashion on the rocks is served in a 4 ounce glass with 5 ounces of rocks... $8. You'd be better off sniffing an empty beer can - and the bartender was surly. 

F -
author: Brad J.

description: Beautiful interior! Old and wooden.  guess I'll add more words because yelp wants that
author: Jeremy S.

description: Wow... "we don't take credit cards, there is an ATM around the corner."  Beer is beer, wings were full of veins but sandwich was alright.  Why would a restaurant by the Wharf not take credit?  Something fishy going on here.
author: Jim S.

description:
Huge selection of beers.
Excellent fresh oysters! 1$ each!
Great atmosphere and live music
author: Sylvain B.

description:
We were just looking for a fast lunch while vacationing SFO and Fisherman Wharf, so we stopped by Jacks Bar and sat on the outside patio.  WRONG PLACE!  The waitress was nice and pleasant but slow.  She said lunch takes about 10 mins.  It's more like 30'minutes.  The veggie sandwich was good.  Slightly crisp on the outside and tasty. However, DON'T order the clam chowder.  Appeared thin and watery and gave me stomach cramps for the rest of the afternoon.  Needed to stay close to the restroom so it ended up being a wasted afternoon!!   Fair warnings to all!  

The most disturbing thing was a worker placed 4 or 5 fluorescent tubes in a large trash can by us.  I was thinking he would just push it outside for trash.  I was shocked when he put a bag over it, then grabbed a hammer and started to smash it in front of us!!!!  As everyone knows, fluorescent tubes contain highly hazardous mercury powder.  The mercury powder started billowing from the trash can and I watched him roll this can into the kitchen where they were prepping our food!!!!!!  I wanted to immediately leave, but my girlfriend was too hungry and wanted stay.  Needless to say, the girlfriend always wins.....even if it hurts us!!!
author: Arnold T.

description:
Worst food I have every been served in the US!
Deep fried prawns came out black, cooked at least three times too long. I don't know how any chef or server could look at that and decide it would be acceptable to charge someone for.
Tried one anyway, completely dry and of course a strong burnt aftertaste.
The shrimp cocktail was also horrible, seemed like it was some sort of canned tomato puree or something.

If you want food, go somewhere else, looks like it might be a decent place for drinks though.
author: Caleb J.

description:
Cash only. They say it so many times.

Beer.

Sourdough bread bowl of clam chowdah. 

Beer.

Tagged up bathrooms.

Beer. 

Sailor's life!
author: Fawn G.

description: Amazing service the bartender was awesome. Beers were great the music was perfect. Didn't eat but for a drink and ambiance it's perfect
author: Roger H.

description: I need to start stopping in more often than I have been its an old school bar there is around 68 beers on tap you can also get a Miller for a couple bucks they have food good jukebox pool table pinball live music outdoor seating in the back good bartender I like to go when its not so busy always find a tourist to talk to  Del Monte Cannery Building from the old days and its not expensive for the area!
author: robert h.

description:
Great staff.  Cash only.  Great beer selection. $1 oysters all day that won't poison you. Great location for sports if you happen to be in tourist territory. 

Great history with this bar, it's quite fun.  You might see people who actually work in the area catching a drink here before or after their shift.  

Highly recommend the raspberry cider and the cream ale.  I thought they were quite tasty.  Can you tell I'm not a huge beer drinker?  I'm so good at describing beer.  It was brown, bubbly, alcoholic?  Ohhhh yeaaaaah. I rock.
author: Susan C.

description: Best cash bar. Good food and fantastic beer selection! A must visit when in San Fran!
author: Keri T.

description:
Reasons why I would move to San Francisco.... THIS PLACE. I want to live here, beer galore. The Irish dude is super cool and very helpful with tips on what is best for each palette. It is not the cheapest place that you will find while walking down Fishermans Wharf but it is the most to my liking. Classic rock and that old dive bar type of feel makes me feel right at home. I wish they'd open one in L.A. then I'd have a go to place for those Friday/Saturday nights when you want to relax and just have a beer. This will be my first stop when I'm back in SF and I honestly can't wait!

Only negative about this place, the bathroom gives me the creeps. It has a weird haunted feeling to it especially when it's only you in there. I tried to be out of there as soon as possible because I felt as though something was watching me. 

Overall a great experience, if you live in SF and have not been here then... Shame on you :) go here and try it, you will find your new favorite bar. Just make sure you bring ca$h. If you do forget to stop by the bank, they have an ATM machine inside the bar to help you take care of your bill.
author: Kathy M.

description:
Large selection (40-50) of beers on tap, live music that's not overwhelming, and plenty of space. You can do worse in the wharf area.

Prices are reasonable, vibe is very kitsche.
author: gregory c.

description: Fantastic beer selection.  Lots of choices, so can be hard to pick a beer.  Always something new to try. Bartenders are great & helpful.  Perfect location on the wharf.
author: Kenneth H.

description: This place deserves the 3 star ranking it has. Solid beer selection, TVs playing multiple sports, the building itself is historic and has character, and the live music is always great. I think it's better for a place to just get beers. The food and table service is ehhhh.
author: Katie B.

description:
This didn't look like the place to come and eat. It looks like a place to come and drink. Somehow 70ish or something like that beers on tap gives that impression.

After a long exhausting day or riding bikes and eating bread I was beat. Time to kick the feet up and get in some brews. Honestly I can not remember a single beer I or the wife had. We each have our preferred beer type so I'm sure we just let the bar tender pull whatever they recommended.  What I do remember is the awesome giant old wood bar. They have a story posted about it on the wall, but with 70 beers on tap who's going to remember the details? Beers were about $6-$8. I'm used to that from frequenting NYC but could be considered a little pricey. You probably shouldn't be in this part of town if your looking for cheap... you shouldn't be in SF if you're looking for cheap. We got drunk and took picture on a giant bear they have when you walk in. Others soon followed. 

I'd like to Return.
author: Christian C.

description: Took about 10 mins to find a hostess in the outside lot, and our order of a chicken sandwich and fries (just one order to split) took around 35 minutes to arrive. The food was good but don't expect a quick bite for lunch if that is what you were looking for, plan for at least an hour.
author: Zach S.

description: Walking around Fishermans Wharf, we couldn't decide on what to eat so we decided to have a drink. We decided to go to Jack's Cannery, walking through the door this place has so many positive vibes. The energy in the bar was pretty awesome, everyone was laughing and having a good time. They have good selection of craft beers which definitely caught my eye. If a bar has good beer maybe they will have good wing, who knows? So I ordered wings. They were great! Cooked to perfection. Breaded just the right way to provide a good crunch! This bar definitely caught my attention. The music playing was legit, a good mix of classic songs. The service was good. The server wasn't talkative, but he was very prompt. He was there when the drinks got low. After the first bite of food he was there to see of we were enjoying the food. So many touristy spots in this area but this local (assuming) bar gets a GOLD star!
author: Quincy J.

description:
Great choices of craft beer and live music. 
They only take cash. Cool atmosphere and great service.
author: Laura B.

description: Drifted in. Lots of taps, funky vibe, $7.00 pints, tons of Anchor on tap. Service was slow, and, hours later, I am still belching the gut bomb burger. So mixed....Maybe great to drift in and have a pint. Super plus...Live jazz.
author: John J.

description: Rarely ever do this but the bartender service was the worse ever in a 20+ Navy career. Stay away!
author: Manuel Z.

description: One star is for service only.  This looked like a great bar and should have been a fun place to hang out.  My sister in law and I are in SF for a few days and popped into this bar for a what should have been a few beers and ended up being one beer.  Jack's has a fantastic selection of craft brews and being from MI, craft beers are a standard for us.  It was 2:30ish and not busy.  We sat at the bar about in the middle, and the bartender (blonde, female, wearing a sweatshirt) asked for our order.  I jokingly said "You have 68 craft brews, we need a minute", she said ok, but we got zero other response, no smile or nod or additional comment.  After several minutes, she came back for our order and we got served.  Although we enjoyed our beers, our bartender made no effort to engage with us even though we made a few attempts at conversation.  We both felt very much like we were being ignored.  As we are drinking our beers, the blonde bartender was yucking it up with what must have been a local, laughing and talking.  This happened with another apparent local at the other end of the bar. I did not expect her to entertain us, but a smile, eye contact or a little conversation would have gone a long way.  Pretty sure that is what bartenders generally do.  We left the tab money, no tip.  On our way out, half way to the door, she loudly says "Have a nice day".  SERIOUSLY? Did she just notice that she ignored her way out of a tip?  This was just not a fun experience.
author: Naoma S.

description: Really nice place for some drinks and to hangout while walking the Wharf.  We had some nice drinks at a good price, the place is CASH ONLY so be ready for that.  There are ATMs in the spot so your covered.
author: Cesar M.

description: We chose to go to Jack's based on Yelp comments, and we are so glad we did!  We actually broke our traveling rule by going to the same place more than once. The oysters on the half shell were so good!  Some of the best we've had!  Definitely made for a repeat visit!  The beer selection was great and always cold.  The live music was fabulous & the service was awesome as well!  Great times at Jacks!
author: Jill F.

description: Incredible selection of mostly draft beers on draft! Awesome staff and awesome atmosphere! Would highly recommend stopping here for a beer or two if you're a brewmaster!
author: Jason T.

description: Cool looking pub, watched the Germany vs. England game there. Gets packed around 3 or 4 pm. Cool atmosphere. Hard to ger service from the bartender. She said that only 3 or 4 bartenders work and they have 3 different bars to sit at. Not sure if she's was making an excuse or what, anyway, the lack of service sucked along with the crappy sarcastic attitude that the bartender gave us, besides that I liked the selection of beer.
author: Brian E.

description:
I was leery of this place when my bf steered me in here.  It's too close to the Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 tourist traps and they were advertising $1 oysters.  Much to my surprise, I really enjoyed my time there.

There's a lot of beers on tap.  The souvenir t-shirts says 84 beers and I counted about 60, so I'm going to say there's about 60-84 beers on tap.  They had a wide selection with local Nor Cal staples (Anchor, Lagunitas, Speakeasy, Bear Republic, Firestone, etal) as well as small batch brews from all over (Hangar 24, Alaskan, Ninkasi, Deschutes, etal).  They'll have a beer for everyone's taste.

What really surprised me were the oysters.  Even at their low price point ($1 each), they were still fresh and went down smoothly.  I ordered 2 at first to try them out and I ended the afternoon downing a whole dozen.  The bar environment was casual, relaxing, and not too loud.  Service was solid and the bartenders managed a good pour.

I'm really happy with the oysters and the beer selection here.  I didn't order food nor mixed drinks so I can't comment on that.  Lastly, it's a cash only joint, which is pretty unusual in this tech heavy city.
author: Jenny O.

description: I'd give it -5 If I could. Poor. Punk bar tender with zero class. No customer service, had I not been with my wife I would have dropped this punk. Argues with customer over a question, I didn't care for a beer ask to change it. End up in an argument no class, even called me a jackass. I had to leverage all my constraints not to deck this guy. Lucky I have a good life and this pathetic excuse of person is much to think about.  I aske to speak to owner which he supposedly called owner Bill. He claimed to have guest over and wasn't there so couldn't comment on the story. That's was his response. What kinda of crap place is this. Stay away I'm usually a give a place chance but this is by far worst service I have ever received.
author: Oscar R.

description: First time trying Jack's Cannery and we will definitely come back for the dollar oysters! We got a dozen and they were delicious. Nice & casual outdoor patio dining in the heart of the touristy Beach St. Nice and quiet try away from the Main Street. Lots of tourists here but also some locals. Recommend getting the Crab hot sandwich for only $17, it was jam packed with 6 crab legs. Also the $15 steak and fries was tasty and worth it for the price. Overall a great experience with good food and friendly staff.
author: Kenny L.

description: They are​ understaffed, we waited forever just to order and in the middle the waiter just left so we did too...
author: Net E.

description:
Don't eat here. This place is by far the worst thing I've ever experienced. There was hair in my food. Then, they tried to accuse it of being my hair. Their service was extremely terribly. The server would say, "I don't work in a kitchen" when I asked simple questions like "does this come with bbq" when I asked if the chicken wings were breaded, the waitress said "obviously"
They upset me so much I left, in which the cook followed me outside the building and threatened to call the cops on me unless I paid for the food that had hair in it. This place is a disgrace. This only scratches the service of the ordeal that I tolerated here. Avoid this place. At all costs.
author: Nicole W.

description: Was looking for a place to grab a quick pint and noticed Jacks Cannery advertised 84 beers on tap so we decided to venture in.  Pretty low key bar but did have $1 oysters which were great and jukebox for some great tunes.  If you want a great selection of craft beer on tap, Jacks is your place.
author: Bradley B.

description:
It has a small entrance and can easily walk by if you're not paying attention. Dark room, wooden floors and one side has table while the other is a bar with a gorgeous view of tap on tap on tap. They had such a large variety and while I was tempted I stuck with my jack and Coke. Here's the kicker...
They serve 2oz Drinks!!!
Yes, your welcome 

The downside...cash only joint

Enjoy!
author: Marcella R.

description:
Horrible! !!!.... drunken waitress, service sucks ass,another waitress gave the remote to the TV to change it,mid game! !?? Bartender didn't know how to make any New drinks. Drunken people never got told to leave.
This is a local bar,for local people ONLY,don't waste your time or money on this place. 

Bar rescue! !!
author: Xavier G.

description:
Large, divey (but not super divey). 
Bar seating, table seating, standing (I like options). 
Live music.
Lots of beer (and decent local beer) on tap.
Mixed drinks OK too.
Good place to chat with old friends over a pint. 
Definitely good location (if you're in the area).
author: Sean M.

description: My girlfriend and I stopped here on a Saturday afternoon for a casual drink during a weekend getaway. Service was average and we both ordered a draft from their list of over 50 available. The bar is cash only so beware of that before you order up. ATM is available if you forget your cash or drink more than you plan on.
author: Landry L.

description: Awesome,  chill fun good beer and spirits. My husband got the oysters good price for them.
author: Yessi T.

description: Love coming to this place, come here every time I visit San Francisco. $1.00 fresh oysters, great beer selection, great tv's, staff a very friendly. No credit cards here so bring cash
author: James J.

description: Enjoying live music and watching the warriors game. Good food good beer. Service is a little slow but did not bother us as we were in no hurry.
author: Cindy M.

description:
I do not have the  occasion very  often  to really  give a bad review, however  this eating experience  was a total disaster.  The waitress  was trying  really  hard to do a good job but she had no support from  the kitchen  or management.   The food was slow and poorly  prepared.  We ordered items from the menu  that were  never delivered to the table.  My shrimp salade looked as though  a total  novis had prepared  it.  The title deal breaker was when  the check came and I was informed  that they were "cash only".  Who would imagine  such a thing.  My bill was well over $60 and  I was not planning  on cash.  No indication it was a cash only place.  Folks this is 2015 ..  who pays cash..
I cannot recommend  this place in any way.
author: Jim T.

description:
What is up with this rude waitress?!  She screwed up my wife's drink order and then blamed her for sending it back when explaining why she forgot another customers drink order. It's been over 20 mins and I still haven't had my order taken. She has been constantly rude this entire time. This is probably a good resturant when this girl isn't working. Unfortunately I will never find out. There are way too many places to eat in SF to waste your time on a place that doesn't value their customers.

Here is your tip... Drop the attitude, honey. Your mediocre looks don't make up for your crappy attitude.

By the way... No soap anywhere to be found (not even any dispensers). Where is the staff washing their hands after using the bathroom? How has this place passed health department inspections?
author: Justin K.

description: I would not even give it one star, but need to post. Walked in mid afternoon, sat down, 15 min no service. Went to the bar and the bartender did not even seem interested in taking my order.  Just left disgusted! Sad, just sad,,,,
author: John E.

description:
I am not one of the people who care about perfect service and finding the best new cocktails etc.
For me what matters is nice atmosphere, nice music and nice people.
I found these at Jack's.
To be honest I fell in love with the place the moment I got in. I love the style of the place!
I had burgers there, really nice, ordered a Weiss California beer that was perfect.
That is all I know but for me it is enough to go there again!
author: Antony T.

description: Worst food on the planet! OVERPRICED. Everything is frozen! Frozen steak, frozen fish and chips, frozen poppers that are empty inside LOL! I was sick for 2 full days.... AND the waiter slipped in an extra $10 on the bill for drinks. Glad my friend read the bill. NEVER AGAIN! It's too bad places on the Wharf with great atmosphere are shameful with their food and prices.
author: Judy A.

description: Ok we went in because it was close and we were hungry. Service was on target and the food came out pretty quick. It's bar food but not  bad and priced well for the area.Yummy steak fries. Great atmosphere and great selection. I left happy. Don't forget to pet the gorilla.
author: Kimball C.

description:
This place is pretty close to a number of touristy places. I think we just came from the Musée Mécanique and had been walking for some time so we decided to stop for a few beers. I loved sitting over at the bar and staring at their, possibly a little less than a hundred beers and some ciders on tap. Great selection!

When we were there sometime last year, it wasn't a busy day and they had maybe 3 other groups in the bar. There was live music, a guy playing the guitar. The place looked a bit dank, but I guess that added to its appeal.

The bartender was pretty friendly and he laughed when he mixed up our orders. Understandable since my boyfriend got the raspberry cider while I got a local beer.
author: Nach S.

description:
Good seating options. Loved the decor of the bar. I liked the fact that it was large and spacey. 
I went on a weekday night and hence there was really less crowd. It was supposed to be open till 1am but they shut it at 11pm (probably because of less crowd). The server wasn't that friendly. 
Overall, it is a pretty good bar with an awesome selection of beers and good music. A great place to chill and catch up with friends.
author: Arushi J.

description: And just like that, Jacks is my favorite bar in San Francisco.  I was near fishermans wharf and wanted to find a bar i've never been to so I went to Yelp and looked for bars nearby.  Luckly I found Jacks.  They have sooo many beers on tap which is amazing but the live music totally made the bar my favorite.  I highly suggest going for a beer and listening to the live music cause it makes for a cool night.  Also, our server was really great (Nick or Dick i'm not too sure) all around good time.
author: Sean D.

description: We came here on a Tuesday night. Cash only spot so that stopped us from ordering too much. A bit pricey but it's about average for the area. Cazadores margarita and a bud light $18.. Staff is friendly and prompt. This place had live music on Wednesday when we walked by on the way to our hotel.
author: T C.

description:
Great bar! My boyfriend and I stopped here twice (or three times?) during our trip to San Francisco in December. The bartenders are very knowledgeable about the numerous beers on tap. I don't know much about beer so I asked our bartender Nikki to recommend something. She gave me a few options and the one I picked was perfect! (Of course I've forgotten the name but cest la vie.)

They are cash only, have an ATM if you need it, and use this awesome old register.
author: Rebecca R.

description: Great place for a beer at the Wharf. Huge selection of draft beers. Bartenders pour a full pint and 2 ounce shots. Food is decent, but its a bar first. Live music. Highly recommend it.
author: Lee K.

description: Great beer selection, knowledge bar staff, close proximity to tourist attractions and nice restaurants.
author: Sam R.

description: Always a favorite! Thank you for carrying local beers as well, huge in my book. Knee deep, scrimshaw, San Diego brews, heretic, etc. If your an IPA guy like me you'll love this place. But yes, cash only.
author: Matt D.

description: Stopped in for "happy hour" and enjoyed our draft beers and a little something to hold us over.
author: Peter H.

description: Service was good but for gods sake do not get the Irish coffee here!!!   Bottom shelf liquor was used and now I feel sick...
author: D J.

description: We sat outside on a sunny afternoon and enjoyed a couple of beers in quaint beer garden. If we had sat inside I may not have liked it as much. Cash only, many tap beers, friendly staff. Easy to like.
author: Eric G.

description:
It was ok.  Kitchen closed  awful early.  But the price is right, lots of beer on tap.  

You have to come for the right reason - lots of beer on tap at fair prices and cheap food.  Just don't come for a fancy, pleasant dining experience like the German tourists who asked us if it was self service here on a Sunday night at 8pm.
author: David J.

description: The taplist was decent but the bartender was stodgy and kicked us out after telling a joke about how he should have some help behind the bar to assist more customers.
author: Steve S.

description:
Jacks serves the worst breakfast and coffee on fisherman's wharf.  Go for the beer, flee from the food.  

The only way to make coffee this bad is to buy the beans that Hills Brothers rejected, grind them and let them age in an uncovered canister for a month.   Then brew through an old sock. 

They ran out of sourdough toast too.  In SF?

The service is indifferent too.
author: Jeff E.

description:
This place is a beer lover's heaven! I would say this is about as good as it gets. I work at a pub in east bay with 36 beers on tap...This place demolishes it with almost 70! Tons of local micro brews... and we showed up for happy hour making four beers $24.

They had live music when we showed up, one man playing the guitar and harmonica, it was awesome. 

The location is perfect as it is tucked away enough to not be super busy (especially for a Sunday) like everywhere else in that area but just close enough to fun tourist-y things like pier 39 and fisherman's warf.

The waiters/bartenders were really friendly and all the decorations on the walls were fun and entertaining conversation pieces. A lot of old school car pictures and old taps coming out from the ceiling!

I can't comment on the food...we got too distracted with all the beer and didn't order anything! 

Will for sure be our go-to place when we take our daycations in the city.

Oh, just a heads up... Cash only! But they do have an ATM
author: Rachel C.

description: Really big selection of craft ales and ciders. Friendly bar staff, and the food range looks good. The beers are superb, with Anchor Liberty being a particular favourite. There's a beer garden round the back, which is spacious, but it takes a while to get a drink from the outside bar. Happy Hour was on from 3-7 while we were here, but be warned: the happy hour prices apply to drinks bought inside only. Drinks outside are full price, and you can't buy drinks inside and take them outside. Other than that, great little bar!
author: Chris H.

description:
I did not eat here. How could I? There was too much beer to expect to have room for food! There were 68 taps with all sorts of California and West Coast microbrews. For someone from out of town, like myself, it was a nice spot to try all of the craft brews I can't get back east in one spot. 

Only downside is that it is a cash only establishment. I would have liked to save the $3.50 ATM fee and applied that toward another beer. 

The beer was reasonably priced between $5-$7.50, which is not bad considering the proximity to the touristy Fishermans Wharf.
author: Phillip N.

description: The outdoor courtyard is perfect for a warm day or for a chilly one if you want a private beer.  Man friend and I came here for dozen oysters ands couple beers. I love the tourists on here complaining of oysters not being prepared correctly....they were A-OK. Esp for $1!! Beer selection was awesome and the bartender was ready with suggestions. She recommended a great(Heretic Evil Cousin) IPA, one I hadn't heard of even though I've had my share! Fun little spot, plenty of tourists to mingle with ;)
author: Aubrey O.

description: Terrible service, the waiter was completely rude, we asked just simple question like an suggestion of a beer on the menu and he not only don't help it all, but also answered in a very rude way, pointing the little menus on the table and obviously mad, he look so unhappy on this job, at the end we asked to split the check and he didn't want to do it, we asked if at least he could give us a cost for our drinks and he refused it, saying he would bring the check, so we can figure it out on our own. First time here and We really get the worse experience ever. 4/28/17 6:05 pm we seated outside and it was only one guy and one girl serving here (the girl seems way nicer). To bad for our first San Francisco experience, and to bad for the business as well, we were planning to stayed here and drink for a while, but after this, one beer sounds like to much. To bad.
author: Rogelio A.

description: Walked in great atmosphere great bar. Order our bloody marys which were phenomenal and then ordered steak and eggs with home fries the four of us when the food was brought out all looked like we were being pranked. Literally they took one steak and cut it into four and a steak nugget no more than one and a half ounces is what was on each of our plates I kid you not I do not have a single potato in my home Fries it was just a big blob of onions and bell peppers and one tiny piece of toast cut in half never again.
author: Key D.

description: Stopped for a beer and watched a baseball game. Live music, friendly atmosphere. Great find!  Only downside: cash only!
author: Lindsey S.

description: Great selection of beers. Neat outdoor area. Only had the oysters as food ($1 a piece!) and they were very fresh and delish.
author: Cheri E.

description: Wow, we found this place while staying next-door in the Argonaut Hotel. We love their huge selection of beers on tap, and local dive bar feel. This place is not caught up in the fisherman's wharf tourism, although is located perfectly to access. Great IPA's and Stouts!!
author: Becky A.

description: The wait was a bit long for the freshly shucked oysters but the live music made it much easier to wait. The oysters are good; very fresh but not the best in town. I definitely cant complain since they are only one dollar per oyster! I also wish they took cards :(
author: Chris N.

description: We stumbled upon this place while just walking around looking at shops. We were intrigued by the 86 craft beers. We each got beers we had never had before and enjoyed them. Their selection was impressive and the outdoor area was cute. The service was not great. It took a few minutes for anyone to even come outside to help us. The outdoor seating is out the backdoor so it's a weird setup. A staff member carried a big bag of trash past us. The prices were also quite steep. $7.50 per beer and cash only.
author: McKenzie H.

description: Meh. Clam chowder thin broth, bacon, which over powered and big chunks of celery and potatoes...not my preferred style. BLTA was good, but came with now mayo. Fries average, not fresh. Nice beer menu, decent mimosa. We sat outside instead of the dark, heavy inside. Over taxed waiter made service a little slow.
author: Sara B.

description:
W didn't eat here, but the drinks were cold, the bar staff was fast and the entertainment was unbelievable.

Seriously, the guy playing and singing was one of the best players I've ever seen.  He played Pink Floyd, Dire Straights, the Police...  amazing, stuff no-one pays because it's not easy.

This is a great place to rest up and have a few drinks.
author: J G.

description: First bar I came by when I arrived in Fisherman's Wharf. The bar had an awesome variety of draft beers. I decided to have a local Heretic IPA, which was great, all Jacks review aside, I would recommend this beer. The place was a little dark and cold from the wind by the door. Separated into tables in one area and bar on the other. The bartender was Irish, which was pretty cool. Who doesn't love foreigners, right!? The pricing is pretty normal, not too cheap nor expensive. Downfall: Cash only!
author: Steven P.

description: Lazy waitress grabbed my beer and dumped it when i went to the bathroom.  Must of needrd s fix, o would have been 5 more minutes.
author: Mark S.

description: Great / Expensive Bloody Mary's. Dark and dingy but the quickest way to fix a hangover!
author: Justin M.

description: Had the margaritas and it was strong and tasty. The Live Music was a good mix minus hip hop but the musician was awesome! Highly recommend when on the Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Naomi D.

description: Great place to grab a drink and relax after a long day at the wharf. Lots of beer options and good oysters. Only problem... Cash only
author: Heath H.

description: Never been to such a rude bar. Tall Caucasian gal with blonde streaks and hoop earrings. Ordered beers and she assumed that we couldn't afford the beer and stated he price of the beer with an attitude. She then shouted at the cooks in the back and said "Why the hell are you cutting Calamari?! Just tell them that we are out of it!" I am not happy with any of the service that was given. I will not be returning to this place at all. I would of given it NO STARS if this is the case!
author: Fam M.

description: Is there a 0 star option? One of the worst places to eat... Terrible staff and don't have knowledge of their own menus. Everyone was really rude and the food was awful. I can't believe this place exist in San Francisco..they should move their business to the other coast of America, where people are known to be unpleasant.. do not eat there you will waste your time and money
author: Mike R.

description:
I didn't order food here, so I can't comment on that.  The bartenders were really friendly, though, and they have an excellent selection of beer on tap.  We came here a second time during our visit in the morning to delight in watching the cowboys lose their chance at the Super Bowl.

During the A.M. visit, my boyfriend got an Irish coffee, paid an extra buck to use Jamison rather than whatever they had in the well.  No big deal...and they made it strong. Yum-E. I had one of the best bloody Mary's ever with plenty of pickled goodness to garnish.  Could have used a splash more vodka, though.
author: Shannon D.

description:
Just arrived in SF for our first visit; staying at the Argonaut and went next door to Jacks for a local brew and chowder. 
Both were great; the chowder was certainly fresh and brothy, just the way I like it; not too thick. 
Great beer selection as well. If you can't find a beer you like here then you're not a beer drinker.
author: Jasomus L.

description:
Man, I'm on a roll with the cranky reviews today!  Well, they all stem from one day this past weekend when my friends and I were out on the town....pretty much everywhere we went had piss-poor service.

Jack's gets two stars for their beer selection, which includes one of my favorites, Magic Hat.  It's a huge bar with tons of space for sitting or standing around.  But good luck getting served at the bar.  It's so ridiculously busy, it takes forever to get noticed.

Cash only, but there are a couple ATMs.

My biggest beef with the place is the fucking bathrooms.  Sweet baby Jesus on a pony, they are FOUL.  The women's bathroom this past weekend was a piece of work indeed.  Soggy wads of toilet paper strewn everywhere, all over the floor, the sink, the counter.....nasty.  No ass-gaskets (there was a dispenser for them, but people had shoved trash and dirty diapers into it instead, what in the fresh fuck?!...and who brings babies to bars??).  NO SOAP.  Are you fucking kidding me?  You go into a craptastic wasteland like this and you can't even wash your hands?!  Ugh.

If this is the kind of attention they pay to cleanliness, I have very low expectations of their sanitation practices behind the bar as well.  No thanks, you won't find me back here again.
author: Heather K.

description:
At first glance this bar or restaurant on the main stretch of fisherman's wharf seems somewhat of a tourist trap. But once inside it definitely feels like an authentic town sports bar. 

Pros.

Plenty of seating with a smaller bar at the entrance and a longer bar towards the middle. 

There's plenty of screens. 

 The menu is cheap and it's somewhat good bar food. 

Ridiculously long list of beers on tap.

Generally cheap prices.




Cons.

The fish and chips is wayyy overpriced ($16). 

No volume on screens. (Even when asking to turn on and a big game is on. Nothing)

Slow service

Not so good live music. 

Touristy, middle aged crowd
author: sam c.

description:
Located at the end of Pier 39... 

All I know is that the menu isn't extensive and service is SLOW however, I must comment that their restrooms are huge and quite clean.  I had to use it to change the boy and I had no problem maneuvering around w/ a stroller.

The boyfriend got 2 beers and I got a Diet Coke.  We shared a 3 piece fried chicken w/ fries.  The chicken was good but nothing to come back for; maybe if you are into alcohol because the guy suggested a beer to the boyfriend; he ended up liking it so he ordered another one.  

We sat there w/o being interrupted whilst we talked about my family, his family, our upcoming vacations together, and everything else in between.  

If you are looking for a quick bite - go elsewhere
If you are looking for a bite (not in a hurry) - go elsewhere
If you are looking for something good to drink (extensive bar) - go here

Thanks, babe for the meal but most importantly, thanks for the experience!
author: Tram N.

description: Great, and I mean great beer selection. Good old school jukebox, and also live music. Cash only though so come prepared or prepare for the atm fee fun fest.
author: A J.

description:
You should pass.
Pretty bad Service. Brought the wrong drinks, and forgot others. Asking again for the missing drinks did not resolve it as the server "forgot again".
Toilets have no soap, yuk, and only a single hand drier that blows a pathetic amount of air..
At 3pm this musician came on, he was fine, but the volume was deafening and ruined the atmosphere for a lot of tables as they couldn't talk.
author: Ian C.

description: The food was average. The service was terrible. It took way to much time before we got our food and beverages. It was only one lady who was serving, so maybe it was special today, but anyway...
author: Cathrine L.

description: Super loud and super terrible. Some dude is playing acoustic louder than the last metal show I was at-and he is not good. Regardless they have a lot of beers on tap but none of them sans maybe old Rasputin are any good. Wait staff are kinda dicks. Cash only at the bar FYI.
author: Tim W.

description:
Bitter beer, sweet service and a telescopic view into what the boss watches in his office (spoiler alert: The Real Housewives of New Jersey).

A bar so full of locals, you'd stumble out forgetting you're near the Wharf, it's likely the pub where actual fishermen pull up a stool and suds away their steamed-in crab stink. Pints run $5-6 - the price a beer should be - and the selection of taps runs the length of the dark wood bar (60+).

Being Boston bred, a "cash only" sign doesn't scare me away and we had no desire to try the food. Jack's is a beer bar, so drink the beer, chat up a stranger and be thankful nobody's trying to sell you a souvenir.
author: Damien S.

description: Every time I am in SF I come to Jacks not once but 2 times a day. I come early for the $1 Oysters, the $5 Ravioli plate, or the Sliders. Happy hour is the best, dont quote me but High Life is $2 a pint on the Wharf. You cant find that deal anywhere. COME TO JACKS
author: Kevin E.

description:
Worst customer service I have ever experienced by the not so lovely waitress Cassy. 
We were a Group of about 11 and sat outside. When we asked if we could move two tables together Cassy gave a long rude commentary about how her boss will yell at her if we do so and if we did she has the right to refuse service. Whoa lady, a simple no we can't do that would have sufficed. 
20 min later she took our drink order and brought me the wrong drink. When I asked her if I could get the correct one she scoffed, told another patron she forgot her order because she had to go fix mine, then ten min later brought me the right drink. 
   When she finally got around to taking our order she said "ok so none of the menu items come with fries," which would have been good info to tell everyone but she snidely added "because I don't want to have to say it over and over 1000 times".  Comments like that dominated every encounter with this gal. 
She forgot everyone's order so when the food came out she decided she would just dump  it on the table. 
++don't come thirsty, she doesn't like to give refills! 
Even the 13 year old at the table who joined late was taken aback by her lack of social skills.
Fast forward to the end when she brings the check; 
" No, we DON'T do separate checks And if we did that's something YOU need to say ahead of time"
(BTW, I was a server for 12 years, even if the customers are wrong and rude, which we weren't, you don't act like that. It's LITERALLY your JOB to be cordial.)
Oh, and in the end she added a hefty 18% tip for herself (even though it wasn't printed on the menu) which I'm pretty sure that's the only way she makes tips considering she was treating all of her other customers the same or worse! 
If management is anything like this chick, I'm sure they will care less about this bad review because most of their business is tourists, but they definitely lost potential regulars that swim at the aquatic Park down the street.
author: Eli S.

description:
85 beers on tap. HH from 3-6pm. Need I say more???

Ok ok, posted up at one end of the fisherman's Wharf was a neon sign that says "85 beers on tap". Obviously, I was in route at this point. 

Place is kinda dive, but I didn't care. 85 taps people....
Made it in at 3:15, just in time for HH. 1$ off drinks. Plenty of space at the bar and even more seating with tables. The bartender was quick to realize I looked thirsty...and cheap (must have had the HH look). Tried a few beers. Stout on nitro was by far the best. Everything was served frosty and promptly. 

Did not try the food. It looked like your typical bar menu. Wings, fries, burgers...

Will definitely go back when I'm in town.
author: Chris D.

description: Came in on a slow Sunday afternoon for a late lunch and beer. They have a great draft selection. Food is typical greasy bar food...not good. You can definitely tell this is an old place as the air smelled damp, dank and stale. They did have a cool old guy playing the guitar and singing. Also wish they had told us about the cash only before we ordered. Thankfully I did have cash. They do have an ATM but would have been charged a fee.
author: Eve S.

description: Very unimpressed with the whole experience. The bloodys were okay, somewhat watered down, but did the trick. The food was bad... I get that it's bar food, but, come on. I'm not sure how a BLT can be messed up, but the bacon was undercooked and and the "side of vegetables" was the mixed vegetables that you get from a can. I was surprised that a place with such a cool atmosphere could be so disappointing. Also, they don't take credit or debit cards, and the ATM was a $3.25 surcharge.
author: Amy J.

description: Dont judge me but I got here about 8:45.  A couple of people at the bar.  I waited a couple of minutes and started looking for the bartender.  They never showed up so I decided to move on. But it looks like it could be fun.
author: Jim H.

description: Found a straw in the Heinz 57 sauce, this place was junk!!!  I do no recommend this place
author: Mike R.

description: Service was pretty slow at the bar all be it valentine's day and a little busy. Nice atmosphere but the 2 stars is for the female blonde bartender at the first bar when you walk in. I understand the bar may close at a certain time although it was only 7:30 pm on a Saturday night...but don't serve your friends at the bar as you tell other patrons you are closed...very bad taste..first time here...won't return.
author: Richard F.

description:
Horrible service is all I can say!
Sat at a open table outside patio looked which looked cool.
Waited for almost 10 minutes no service ever though the waitress saw us sitting there.
I had to go flag her down asked if they were still serving food she said she had 1 more order to take 
Saw we had kids with us and kinda scoffed and said no I am not serving anymore food out here.
WTF KIND OF BS IS THAT
So we got up and left.
Jacks used to be cool but its not if you have kids I guess.

Will never be coming back here again! Even though the beer selection is good
author: John L.

description: Walked in at 11 on a Saturday. Walked up to bar, started ordering and was interrupted for ID's. After some rude gestures and doubting the validity of our NV ID's, took order. Not even half way through our drinks and they call last call... 11:30 and says they are open until 2. The only bar that is still open in fisherman's warf, and they close early...
author: Dallas O.

description:
Quite possibly my favorite bar in these United States.  
There were so many beers on tap here it was unbelievable. I drank here for about eight hours and didn't repeat a single brew. The bartender was very helpful in her suggestions and explanations of all the brews on tap.
My group and I came here early on a Sunday morning to catch our east coast football team. The employees of Jack's were good enough to put the Eagles game on and let us stay for hours to watch. Not to mention, they have a great breakfast menu. 
This is a trivial detail, but whatever radio station they play here is kick ass...the music is so good! 
Jack's really captures the essence of what I love most about the west coast-one's ability to catch a buzz and watch football early on a Sunday morning.
author: Mallory D.

description: Great dive bar feel. 2 bars, one at the entrance, one further in. Tons of beers on tap, definitely a beer bar, I asked for a shot of tequila, they only had a couple of gold ones in stock.  Had the oysters they advertised for $1 a piece, fresh but small. Waiter super sweet.  They had all the sports on, live music and pool table in the back. I've passed by this place for years, I think I'll be back. Huge restaurant area that was completely empty, maybe because it was Easter.
author: Angie G.

description:
"Do not let me drink any beer east of the Mississippi River"

That was my only rule for the bartender, and they obliged by making sure I traveled(via beer taps) through Colorado, Washington state, Oregon, and Alaska before arriving on the San Francisco brews. 

For a bar right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, this was a great reprieve from the area that screams, "BUY A SF SWEATER! YOU'RE COLD! SEE? BUY A SWEATER!!".

Their burgers went well with the beers, and overall I had a great time here. If you're a fan of dive-ish bars, this place will feel like home. I will definitely swing by on my next West Coast trip.
author: Mickey M.

description: Quite possibly the coolest bar in San Fran...  The draft beers are cold. The staff is amazing and engaging. Great place.
author: Jen H.

description: I'll give it  a  5. I didn't have expectations on service, which is good because  it was slow. However, the food and drinks were what I was hoping for so another words it was good.
author: Terry W.

description:
We love this place..  We always stop here when visiting the wharf in beautiful San Francisco...

To be honest, I've never eaten here - only had the calamari appetizer and it's good!  We always stop for some beer.  They always have great live music and the staff is very friendly..  Neat place to stop and the bloody mary's are pretty tasty as well.

Cheers...!!!
author: Annette P.

description:
Large bar area with an above average beer selection. The problems stem from the service. There were roughly 20 other patrons.
