It took far too long to order my beer because the servers and bartenders were busy gossiping. After five minutes of waiting, I was finally able to order a beer. Ten minutes later, it arrived. Then another five minutes to put in my food order. 25 minutes later, the food arrived and was rather  oily. 

I just wasn't impressed, I won't return. Only garnishing a second star because of the beer selection.
author: Justin C.

description: Good food, has an indoor and outdoor bar. Nice clean bathrooms. Been here a few times.
author: Krista H.

description:
I still love this place. I don't know why I just do. 

I ordered my usual Boddington's and we took them outside through the back door to drink and smoke our stogies. 

It was very quiet the day we went. I would like to take note that the bathrooms have been freshly painted and the lovely smell of bleach was in the air. That usually isn't the case. 

This is just a great bar to chill. I don't expect anything more or less from here except to have a nice beer.  They have a great juke box also. 

 So chill, put a few bucks in the juke box and shut up.
author: Ivy R.

description: We were on town for one more night and needed find a place to watch football and drink beer. This place has its own personality. Service was awesome and it has two bars. There were about 4-6 TV's with different sporting events. Plus there was 2 pool tables. Our waiter was helpful choosing a draft beer and even held on to my shades for me after we had left the bar. It's conveniently located right off the Fisherman's Wharf and a good spot to chill and drink. Definitely will come back if I'm back in this area..
author: Eli H.

description: Fine outside looks like a cool place. Music was good. Food was ok.... Had better. Took a long time to get our food and oyster came after we had our food and weren't properly prepared. Waitress was not friendly and asked only once if we needed anything. NO warning or indication CASH only bar u too we had to pay. What if we did t have cash. Won't go back there.
author: Pamela S.

description: This is a fun Frisco spot down near the water. A lot of taps to choose from, but I felt I got a little jipped, as my friends each ordered pints for $6 and I wanted to try a couple of options, and ended up with a flight of (3) 4 oz shooters which cost me $10....not sure how 12 oz costing more than 16 oz is a better deal.... I might come back if I were in the area and wanted a beer - good chance of finding a decent choice...but not on my MUST return list for future Frisco trips.
author: Dani Z.

description:
I visited Jack's Cannery Bar with three other people for a late breakfast.  Yes, it is in a touristy area, but I happen to know it has regulars, too.  We were looking for a place to eat after leaving our hotel and saw a sign outside advertising a $5 breakfast.  An old man who we assumed was the owner (it turns out he's not) sat on a stool beside the sign.  We asked him if they were still serving breakfast.  His response: "Hmm...let me think about it."  Pause.  "Sure."  Okay then.

He led us in and we sat at a large table near a television.  It was not at all crowded, but that was just how we wanted it.  I think we all instantly liked the feel of the place; the decor, the energy.  I was impressed with the number of beers on tap.  

The waitress was young and friendly and attentive.  I tried to order a Coke but they only had off-brand sodas, which was fine with me.  I ordered a typical breakfast plate for about $5: bacon, eggs, toast, hash browns.  It was exactly what you'd want in a breakfast plate.  Very satisfying.  

I would have given this place four stars if it weren't for one factor: we waited for our food for what seemed like forever.  It was pretty ridiculous, because there were hardly any other patrons at that time and everything we ordered was pretty simple.  Other than that, I liked the place and recommend it if you're close by.
author: Casey B.

description:
07/13/2013 6:30 - 9:00PM

When did customer service ever depend on ones mood? Well, I have to say that this night depended on that.

My 1-star rating is based on: 0.5 for attempt at providing quality customer service, and 0.5 for quality of the food (sadly, this score would truly be a 3 if our waiter was more accommodating - my friends said that though the food was not gourmet, it was good enough).

I would have never chosen this spot for any outing, event, or gathering, but came since this was for my friends birthday.

Decor is quite eclectic, with some British flair - certainly made me want some shepherds pie. Space is large, and is nestled within a touristy area.

Lets get to the actual review: I brought a cake in celebration of my friends birthday, and upon asking our waiter (man in his 40's, caucasian, bald, and wearing a yellow t-shirt stamped with a star in the center - didn't quite get his name) if we could serve our cake here - I was told that there would be a fee, and it wasn't said in a nice way, more of an attitude. I politely declined and said that we will eat this cake elsewhere. (As I continue with this review, he continues to instigate and contribute more attitude regarding serving my cake).   

Everything on the menu is expensive! I can see why: TOURISTS! On their actual menu, at the very top right hand corner, it read - and as I quote from memory, "We do not accept cards, cash only, there are two ATM's on site - $1.50 added to go, $6 minimum to order from the menu". This is the new age, establishments should have the options of both cash and credit/debit. My friend ordered a cheeseburger ($7.75, which does not include cheese, $1.00 to add cheese, and neither did it come with fries - an extra charge for that). She also ordered 3 sodas and was charged $9 (really, for coke, yes really). And lets be honest, with all the fees that banks charge nowadays, I would prefer not to use one of those DINKY THIRD PARTY ATM's, and that's exactly what i did.

Our waiter continues to make his rounds, making sure that we have everything we need - okay service, sure. My friends ask for the check, while they were paying, the table next to us (also our group, we had probably 13 people in total) - I hear one of the members say as the same waiter walks away "oh what, you really think your service equates to a $10 tip". I thought that was intriguing, up until the same waiter questions my booth (which I did not order, but my friend did) why such a small tip was left - then it made sense. Excuse me, tips are based on ones level of service - we can give as little or as much as we find valid. My friend felt so angered, that her husband removed the tip that the waiter leaves in favor for a penny - yes a penny. I would have left nothing!

My friends and I were talking about how our waiter expected a high tip for his "exceptional service", he walks himself to our booth and says "with the little tip you left for me, that could have been for the cake service charge". Excuse me, I had already said no and that we would eat it elsewhere, why pick a fight? He then continues with "if you go to any other restaurant, they would certainly charge you for bringing in outside food". Technically, I have never been told that such a fee is mandatory with the restaurants I've been to, in fact, we left Jacks Cannery for Apple Bee's for dinner and they gladly chilled our cake and even served it without charging anything extra. 

It's 8:30PM and we get ready to leave, and again, another instigation. "I hope you really enjoy that cake" - in a very nasty tone. The waiter continues (again), "restaurants will charge you for bringing in outside food, even if it's for someones birthday". I told him that I don't need anyone repeating themselves. He added (again) "well, I would have gladly served your cake had you paid the extra fee or use the tip that you and your friends left behind". I was also called CHEAP and a six letter word that I will not spell out but will define (noun: child born out of wedlock). Terrible customer service!

My friends mother at this point walks in to Jacks Cannery as we are ready to leave, and she over hears the whole conversation. She is also given some feedback (from the entire group that this same waiter has provided us with terrible customer service). She approaches the manager on duty at the time, and her response was that "oh, he is having a very bad day, I am so sorry that he treated you and your group that way". From the kitchen, she said she could hear that same waiter yelling the FWORD repeatedly. She is then given the number to the owner of Jacks Cannery, "Bill", that should a complaint be filed, he is the best person to reach. 

I am appalled with the word that I was given and associated with. Let this be the first and last time that I ever step foot into Jacks Cannery. 

Answer this, are you having a bad day? If you answered yes to that - bite your tongue and do your job.
author: Alex C.

description: Dropped in for a few drinks while visiting the pier and I'm surprised about many negative reviews. Plenty of beers on tap and the bartender is easy to talk too and frequently comes over to make sure everything is good. Sunday night was kinda quite but the sound of jazz in the background made it very comforting! Definitely will come back!!
author: Tory P.

description: Great beer selection! I haven't tried the food. But BEER!!!!! Friendly staff and sometimes local musicians :)
author: Lady T.

description: $1 oysters/beer selection here are great but service can be quite slow. The outdoor area is perfect on a gorgeous day. Usually street performers are playing as well. Great ambiance. Tip-CASH ONLY
author: Mae B.

description: Happy hour, A dollar oyster every day can't go wrong!
author: Amie A.

description: Jack's is huge. It is warehouse huge, but don't let that fool you. At it's heart it's still a dive bar. Service is spotty at best, but when you do get ahold of a waitress they are super awesome. Great beer offerings and a nice patio to sit outside and watch the wharf tourists walk around. Good, standard bar food that doesn't disappoint.
author: Joshua C.

description:
To start, we ordered a PBR draft...but they were OUT. Who boasts about having 85 drafts on tap if you are going to be out of brands?? 

Then, we said that we needed a few minutes to decide what we wanted to eat because we wanted to enjoy our beers. The waitress NEVER returned to take our order, or ask if we wanted another drink. We had to go to the bartender to get another draft (twice). 

We then went to our server at 8:40pm (after waiting two hours) to ask to order our food. She then decided to tell us the kitchen closed at 8:30pm. If you know your guests are wanting food and have menus on the table, at least inform them when the kitchen will be closing and have the courtesy to give them a little bit of customer service. There was only about five tables in the restaurant so there was no reason for our server to ignore us. We ended up leaving, starving, and going to another restaurant. 

Only go to Jacks Cannery if you enjoy being neglected and want a good laugh at the horrible display of customer service.
author: Quack Attack Z.

description:
Loved this place. Stopped here with my brother visiting. We sat at the bar for hours trying all different beers. They had TONS of beers on tap. It was impressive. 

There was as pac man table that was fun and all around a great vibe for the place.
author: Katherine J.

description: Went in because I saw the one dollar oysters. I figured they would be small because of the price but they were medium sized oysters, score! Amazing selection of draught beer, great service and good live music. This place rocks!
author: Ryan P.

description: Mediocre. The food was eh.. Alright. I've honestly had better clam chowder in Stockton California. The lemon drop was good but small at 8 a pop I was good with one. I probably won't be back. Way better places to eat in this area.
author: Chloe R.

description: Live music, great choice of brews and pretty spacious bar/restaurant. Kind of a divey atmosphere, but feels to be on purpose.
author: Tom F.

description:
Stop #2 on the bar crawl. This place has an AMAZING beer selection. Try the magic hat #9, I guarantee you will love it. 
They also had a blueberry ale which was delicious, and I had a sip of someone's raspberry cider which was so tasty and perfect for the non-beer drinking crowd. 

Beers are $6 each which is pretty reasonable and the bartender was friendly and knowledgeable. 

Although we had a hard time squeezing everyone in 1 booth, this is a big bar and can easily accommodate a lot of people.

As an added bonus, they have a photobooth so after you've had a few beers you can take home a souvenir of your drunken debauchery. 

With so many beers left to try, you know I'll be back!
author: Rachel E.

description:
3.5 stars

The live music drew us in - a guy playing guitar with a little of country and soft rock.  Not sure how many times we've walked by but never notice this spot.  

There is a bar to the left as you walk in and a bigger bar to the right as you enter inside.  Plenty seatings and some booths - we took one of the booths inside.  There is a pool table all the way in the back near the outside patio.  There is a large fireplace in the middle of the place, as well as a photo booth tucked near the bathrooms. 

A good selection of drafts - the menu says 80.  We have had most but found a few we haven't heard of...what we had:

one each of Blue Star and Downtown Brown - $13.50
 
double cheese burger - $6 - not knowing what kind of burgers they serve, hubby asked for medium rare.  waitress said the patties are really thin so it's likely not possible but will ask.  I think we were punished for asking because the patties were charred - it was like having jerky. 
 
oysters - $1 each, minimum 6 - we had a dozen.

Love the ceiling and all the dark wood decorative paneling.
author: Gloria H.

description: We came for the beer and the football game but I was very surprised by the food! The wings were very good...crispy and fresh. The sweet potato fries were great too! The staff was knowledgable about the beer.
author: Lisa A.

description: The bar is a bit schizophrenic in that it can't decide if it's a taproom, a frat/sports bar, or a neighborhood party dive - so I reckon it's all of the above.  I echo others' sentiments that it's relatively chill on off-nights, but never been here on the weekend.  Really good mostly West Coast craft beer selection - but WARNING! - cash only.
author: Tom M.

description:
Just DON'T GO in there! We went there today for lunch, and this is what we got:

- 10 minutes before the waitress acknowledged that we had sat down and brought us menus
- 10 more minutes before they took our order
- 20 minutes for one burger and one order of chicken strips to arrive
- The TOMATO in the burger had a PRICE STICKER on it. Do they even wash their veggies? The meat was substandard, soggy and burned at once.
- The waitress then brought me the wrong bill: yes, she had struck off the burger, but it was from the bill of the party in the next table!
- The waitress then brought the right bill, and in that one the total was $1 more than the the sum of the items + tax (at this point I didn't care, just needed to get the hell out)
- The waitress then brought me the change, shortchanging me by $0.25 just to be sure.

Needless to say, this was a clusterf#¢k of a lunch. I felt sick afterwards, I still do. Not sure if it was the half a burger I had, or the service.
author: Mikko J.

description: My boyfriend and I got violently ill after stopping here, him for a beer in a dirty glass and me for a $1 oyster that I projectile vomited a bit later.  Neither of us had gotten food poisoning in years, and we are still recovering 18 hours later.
author: Caroline N.

description: Really plastic cups for beer and crap chowder... will never come back! THIS IS TRULY a crap place. DO NOT EAT HERE!
author: Chris B.

description:
In response to taking forever (45 minutes), the waiter said "we're not fancy, we only have one cook". When the food finally arrived, it sucked.
WTF?
author: glen f.

description: Poor service!!! Oysters on the half shell weren't served correctly. I had to cut them away from the muscle!!! Ranch dressing was awful!  The waitress acted like I didn't order food when I asked her about it, not cool! Then when it was time to pay, the waitress announced that it was CASH ONLY!!! No sign anywhere saying that!  Craziness
author: Katrina J.

description: They seem like a nice fast place to eat in that area, that's why we sat down outside for a beer and a burger. They only take cash so I had to go inside to use the ATM. Inside they had TVs and live music looks nice for an evening drink with friends. Waited for the food for a while, not sure what happened, and then it came super hot. I know this is not the usual and sometimes you just get off the kithcen's radar, but it sucks when it happens to you.
author: Gabe P.

description: Cool little bar and a wonderful bartender who poured us great drinks amd tvs for the game with music and a stuffed gorilla
author: Renee G.

description: Nothing special,  bartender was bordering on looking like he was annoyed by customers,  verbally complained out loud that a customer (she) deserved to be punched in the face after a tip he thought was too low.
author: Jim S.

description: Do yourself a favor and stay far away from  this place. The server was sooooo rude to us. Unbelievably rude. It was inexcusable what she said and how she treated us.  The only thing that was slightly better was the low quality food.
author: Steve S.

description: Worst server I have ever seen. She started taking orders from customers who came after us. She did not even clean table and totally ignored us. She might not have taken any serving classes but she did not even have any common sense. We left after waiting for 20 minutes.
author: Viney G.

description: What an amazing spot in a tourist area! When the corporate burger joint a block away had a line out the door we kept walking on. Found this place and when we opened the door it wasn't packed. Stepped in and found the had 80 Beers on tap! The burgers were huge for $6.00 and was not a frozen patty! For $5 you get enough fries to f Ed a family of 4 and have everyone happy! We will be back next time we are in town.
author: Sandy S.

description: Chowder was ok at best (eatable). Cash only! Everything fried. Chicken sandwiches,  fried cutlet. Needless to say, not coming back...
author: Shannon B.

description:
I was cruising canary row, looking for a place that wasn't so touristy, with a good dive bar feel...I found it.

The ambiance was perfect, a little dark, a little dingy and a good crowd of people for 3pm on a Saturday.  

I went up to the huge bar with about 50 beers on tap and asked if they had any Belgium beers.  The bartender smiled and asked me if I had visited the other side of the room (directly behind me), the bar that only serves Belgium beers!  I promptly spun around and moved to the other taps.  Ah, 15 Belgium beers on tap...heaven on earth.  

I decided on a 5 beer sampler (for $15.25 - a little strong on the pricing, but what the heck).  The bartender was a little slow, not sure what that was all about, but hey I wasn't in a hurry.  My beers arrived, and as I began sipping on my Belgium gold, live music started playing in the bar (a one man show, but it added to the atmosphere).  

I continued drinking my beers and began to forget about where I was, I almost thought I was in Europe enjoying live music in a dark dingy room with great beers.  It wasn't until the clouds of pot smoke began blowing in the front door that I remembered I was in San Francisco, home of medical marijuana, or, well, whatever.  That might have explained why the bartender was so slow or unresponsive - maybe what they say about second hand smoke is true...

If you are looking for a dark, dingy, unpretentious bar with great beers, this is the place to visit.
author: Daniel A.

description:
Do NOT eat here. I've never had heartburn, until now. I burped for hours after eating the fish and chips.
Good service, good decor, good beer. Chowder tasted good but was thin and small bowl for price; over deep fried fish sticks with a few fries for $16; fresh but small oysters $1 each.
I'd come back for beer but definitely not eat here.
author: Angela J.

description: Would be a 2 on the food but the excellent beer menu bumps it to a 3.  Prices for draft were $7 which is even higher than beer in Canada.  Go and have a couple pints just to try the beer but don't go for the food when there are so many other places to eat.
author: Keith S.

description:
It was a busy Sunday cold afternoon here.

I came for the restrooms.
author: qirk z.

description: I wanted to like this place so bad!! The atmosphere was good and our waiter was nice but we waited a really long time for some one to even bring us menus then again waited for ever to get our drinks. Then took about an hour to get our food and it wasn't even that busy. And it wasn't nothing to ride home about. Pretty basic. My husband sliders were raw in the middle but we didn't want to send them back cause he didn't want to wait again.  Maybe it was just a bad day.
author: Krystle T.

description:
Cash only, eccentric beer pub with over 68 beers on tap!

A large, dive-type bar right on the wharf by all the touristy restaurants and shops. Stumbled upon it before dinner on the pier to have a quick brew. They don't offer any descriptions of their vast amount of beers but I picked a good one out. Beers were cheap, and it wasn't crowded at 5 on a Friday. There was a music stage with a guy strumming, so I'm pretty sure it turns into a jam session late-night.

Go for the beer and bring cash. The end!
author: Susan F.

description: Walked into Jacks bar expecting to find a fun place to have a drink or two. What we found ( we were two couples) was a rude unwelcoming bartender with an ugly attitude. We will never go back or recommend this bar to any of our friends. Service is just as important as food or drink.  We can understand someone having a bad day but, why take it out on the patrons?  By the way this was a Friday night.  We were just starting the night had plenty of money and we are four responsible people. No one was being obnoxious or crazy.  He was just a very unprofessional bartender.   I feel sorry for him. He shouldn't be in the People business.
author: Julia G.

description:
MOST EXPENSIVE BEER IN SF!
Used to go every weekend last year, beers were about $7 which is expensive for SF
Went for 2 this afternoon outside and they were $9 plus tip a beer!!
Wow, won't be going back
author: Esther R.

description: Great beers but kicked my Australian friends out for not tipping enough. Not cool. Cultural differences not accepted.
author: Erin R.

description:
Very pleased to try this bar.  Very impressed with their beer taps.  The selection definitely reflected California (and West Coast) microbrews in a great way.  Kudos to the team that pick these brews. 

For those of us who live in SF and have to occasionally play tour-guide, we FINALLY have a place to go and have a good beer with our out-of-towners.  

I will go here again, even without my visitors.  Loved the beers and found the bartenders to be most accommodating.
author: Joe W.

description:
I've never been to a bar with as many beers on tap, but I've never paid so much for a beer before either. They have 68 beers on tap, though I'm sure a good number of them are out. Of the 68 choices, I had a Dogfish which turned out to be $8.50!

Nevermind the drinks, let's talk about the food, which our waitress messed up three different times on:

strike one: We ordered fries with one of our sirloin steaks, but we were given a baked potato.

strike two: We ordered a bread bowl of clam chowder, but got a bowl instead. I do have to say that the clam chowder was very chunky with clams, though the soup part was watery.

strike three: One guy had asked for a Sierra Nevada Seasonal, but got an Anchor Steam instead.

(CASH ONLY)
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Good beer selection, though they never update their menus, so you never know what they actually have.

The service is terrible, though.  I waited at a table for ten minutes and nobody took my order, so I walked out the door.  This is typical for them.  I guess they live on tourists, not locals, so they don't need to worry about pleasing their customers.  

And seriously, cash only?
author: Daniel M.

description:
Stopped by in late afternoon.  The place smelled terrible (like stale beer with mold that hadn't been mopped up for a long time.)   The music was way too loud and trapped in the 80's.

The bartender was uninterested in serving us.  While they had a good range of beers, the menu was hard to read.  It had no descriptions.  When I asked for more detail, the bartender was gruff to us and had virtually nothing to say but... "Yes, that's an IPA." 

Would rather spend my money a place with fewer choice to get better service and better aromas.
author: Tony S.

description:
Veritable selection of beers on tap, great live music on Saturday afternoons, and lots of seating. 

Got 3 draft beers for $20. 

Cash only!

Bathrooms were fairly clean.
author: Andrea B.

description: Worst wait staff! Sat 15 min, asked a waiter for help 3 times, finally left! Never even got attention. Horrible sense of service.
author: Matt H.

description: 5 stars because they carry soooo many delicious IPAs. Probably the best thing about being in the Fisherman's Wharf area! Remember to bring cash!
author: Cat M.

description: I can't really comment on the food or drink because we walked into the place, got dirty looks from all the patrons already seated and than the staff didn't even bother speaking to us. After waiting for 10 mins to be even spoken to, we decided to take our business else where. Considering this was our 3rd stop on our "pub crawl", it was disappointing that given the very cool atmosphere, to have such a rude experience!!!! But that's ok since there are no lack of bars to try in this area!!! Onto the Blue Mermaid next door!!!
author: Cassie O.

description:
fun place to drink. servers were rude, even though they normally have last call at 1:45 A.M. I had a drink *ripped* out of my hand at 12:45 AM and was told to get out. if this was any other night other than last night id at least give them a 3 or 4.

control your employees
author: James H.

description: Clean, friendly staff, super layed back with over 60 beers on draft. Hubby was happy the beer was super cold.  Kind of empty during the day if you like to avoid crowds.  We enjoyed our time together as we watched San Fran's baseball game. Nice spot if your visiting near pier 39.
author: Jewelz C.

description:
Hate when bars charge more than $1 for soda!!

Like I paid $5 for a cup of soda ugh...hate especially when it probably cost them like 5 cents. Great beer selection. Its nice...a little chilly but great to sit outside. Bartender was average...not over the top friendly.
author: Talisha M.

description: Loved our bartender. Very knowledgeable about local craft beers and the local wines. Fun crowd and my wife loved the Irish coffee. Didn't try the food but the oysters looked great.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Adequate place to go when hungry, tired, and not in the mood to be critical.

I got a cheeseburger. It tasted like a cheeseburger (no frills), there were clean containers of mustard and ketchup on my table, and the burger was easy to eat. It made me happy. I wish it came with fries though, fries were separate at an additional $3.25! Like...not cool.

Their tables were sticky and as my friend said, "smelled of spilt beer." That was cool though, it's a bar after all. But other than that this place was normal, uninteresting, and forgettable. It satisfied my empty stomach and urge for something hearty, but I'm sure In-n-Out would've been just as adequate.
author: Sarah W.

description: I finally checked this place out and I couldn't figure out where all the mediocre reviews came from.  The place has an amazing interior and there are a plethora of beers on tap.  I dove into that Alaskan Amber.... The bartender was attentive and I didn't think it was over priced for a place of that caliber in that part of town.  All in all, I dig Jacks.
author: Sin F.

description: I'm not sure about the food, but the beer selection is excellent here. They do have $1 oysters and they were delicious. There are beer 68 taps available, but you better bring cash because they do not take debit or credit. There's also an old school Galaga machine :)
author: Ken T.

description: I love coming to Jack's for beer when I'm visiting San Francisco! Hands down, this is the largest and best selection of beers you will find in a bar. Every time I come here, I get a different beer I haven't tried before, and all of them have been delicious. I haven't tried the food here, I just come here for the beer. The environment here at Jacks is awesome too.
author: Allison S.

description: Bar looks great from the outside. Great place inside with the Irish theme. Only take cash which is their way of saying they are to cool! That's fine whatever! Sign on the wall asking for permission to take pictures.  I should ask! Lots of beer on tap with three from SAN Diego. Nice place
author: Cody K.

description:
Love this place. It's like a glorious oasis unto itself, tucked away and smack dab in the middle of the touristy, overpriced, annoying chaos of the wharf. For some inexplicable reason, this bar never gets inundated with tourists and is always quiet, comfortable and a great spot to enjoy a pint. They have about 60 different taps so there's a great selection to choose from, especially Anchor.  

Acoustic music on Fridays is always good and they have a patio for when the weather is nice.
author: Steve B.

description: Jacks is a must when on the Wharf. They have a HUGE beer selection, live music, good bar food... And $1 oysters!! Although it's in the hub of tourist attractions, it has a very warm, locals bar feel to it.
author: Halina C.

description:
If you are looking for a nice comfy kiiiiiinda divey but very ecclectic pub.. then this is the place! I'm reading the other reviews and come on now people.. this is a pub.. not a high class place.. it's a bar.. a pub... with lots of beer and lots of seats for people to hang out!

I didn't eat anything we just had drinks... I had an apple cider which was soooo good but then had to end my time there with some Jameson on the rock ;o)

I was very very very pleased with the jukebox music selection!!! A Brit would be sooo happy with the songs in there! 

My selections were I Will Follow - U2, Night Train - James Brown, and Hello, I Love You - The Doors.

They had alot of Brittish and Irish bands too!!!

MOS DEF a stop for me next time I'm in SF!

CHEERS!
Puffy
author: Janeen S.

description: CASH ONLY.  Good beer selection, good basic food.  Good live music, and a very cool building.  The bar tender did refuse to serve me a beer I wanted because "he didn't like the brewery" so that was kind of douchy, but all in all a good time was had.
author: Jo-Ellen D.

description: This bar was pretty awesome! The staff was pretty bland...waitress yelling at the owner...bartender pretty stiff and no fun. But the beers were excellent! The food was so-so. I had a sh*tty BLT and my husband had the clam chowder and calamari. But it was a bar that had tons of beers to choose from! There was also a live musician playing some pretty awesome cover songs at 3 in the afternoon! Can't beat that.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Lots of beers! Good beers too. Some shady characters in here sometimes so watch your wallet. Or bring a knife. I had the big daddy ipa on tap and played some pool with some lady friends and had a pretty solid time. The prices are high but someone has to pay the overhead on the wharf... Great location.
author: Chris P.

description: My husband and I love this place and hit it at least once or twice every time we visit SF.  Yes folks, its CASH ONLY but they have an ATM right in the bar to make things pretty easy for you.  Its an unpretentious place with a FABULOUS beer selection for us beer snobs.  Trust me on this one- if you have a passion for beer, you will be a happy camper at Jack's.  A happy bonus I discovered during our visit last week was the $1 oysters and the $10 crab leg and claws platter. Seriously?!?!  So awesome and they totally hit the spot with a couple of well selected pints!
author: Jen O.

description: My goodness what a great bloody Mary. The world's best that -I've ever had
author: Jennifer H.

description: Had a friend visiting from out of state in September and we wound up here at Jacks Cannery Bar had a good time and the beer's on tap amazing ... ordering! ... O"and the oysters on half shell must have with your choice of brew. Also this is a cash only bar and lucky for me I had cash on me that day..which never happens..just pull out the plastic but not here.
author: Holly W.

description:
Again this is where yelp needs half stars. This place is more of a 2.5 star place. Great beer selection! I f you go go for the beer only. Food is edible. The servers and bartenders are downright unfriendly. I mean DMV and Postal worker unfriendly.

A few odd things about this place, many tourist come in take photos of themselves in here and then leave like it is a famous landmark. Another odd item is that two of the televisions show Studebaker commercials from the '50s and '60s and nothing else.
author: Thomas M.

description:
WORST SERVICE EVER!!!   

We sat outside and the waitress said her shift was over and we would have to wait for her replacement.  No problem... except that we sat there for 30min watching her walk past us serving her existing patrons but refusing to take even a drink order from us.
author: chris p.

description:
I discovered this bar with my boyfriend last June and we had a great time. Since then we come back because we love the large amount of beer they have on tap, the jukebox, and its a chill pub. We had such an awesome time that we hyped this place up and ensured a wonderful.
When we got then, everyone was in a "lets get this party started!" We showed our ID's, he said okay to everyone except for one of our friends. He wouldn't accept a Mexican visa. Humbly, our friend said not to worry. He wouldn't drink. The bartender comes back and said "Actually, you can't be in here at all."

1. This is a pub. Families with young children come here. Even if he wasn't of age, there is no need to kick him out. 

2. He belong with our big group of friends. How rude to single some one out and be condescending to them.  

So my boyfriend and I stayed behind because we were able to get our drinks. Our group left and we agreed to meet up later. The bartender comes back and says to my boyfriend, "Sorry, he could have gotten that down in mission somewhere."

3. Excuse me! Just because there isn't an British street in San Francisco, you can't assume it's a fake without actually trying a UV light or something.

4. This pub is full of foreigners. I have met people all over the states and from England in this pub. Don't try to act like you don't permit people from different countries in there. 

I used to love this place but now, I refuse to go back to a place that made my friend feel lower than him. This man was racist and I do not condone or will not over look that.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This place was cool, a really old bar with 2 separate bar areas and lots of tables provides amble seating for multiple people. A huge selection of beer and booze at moderate prices for the wharf is cool. Lots of tvs to watch sports and even live music. One guy was actually one of the best local artist I have heard recently. 

It is a good tourist spot to relax your feet and grab a drink.
author: Kate D.

description: I wasn't there very long, but it was cool. Old, but comfortable. Staff was friendly enough, but their liquor inventory was limited. Didn't eat anything, just had a few cocktails. I'd definitely come back.
author: Paul L.

description: Cool place and very nice bartender however they only take cash would of been nice to know up front luckily we had the money after we had our drinks with friends
author: Nelson A.

description:
I must preface this review with a note on my experience at Jacks.  It was horrible.  I went for my friend's birthday.  It was a long day and we ended up here because Capurro's across the street was booked for a private party on a Saturday night.

From the outset, the place looks like a bar.  But, it does have tables in the back for dining.  It also had signs for specials out front.  Unfortunately for us, food is not the highlight of a Jacks Cannery Experience.

When we sat down to order, the place was practically empty.  This might be due to the fact that there was a solo acoustic guitar guy playing and singing enthusiastically the same pattern, over and over.  Grateful Dead inspired, but that is as far as it went.  It was not musically pleasant and it was so loud.

Surprisingly, the service was not particularly fast.  So, we got the menu.  It is limited.  My first order was unsuccessful.  They have a bunch of plastic banners outside advertising dinner specials.  When I tried to order one, the waitress kindly informed me that they haven't had those specials in a long time and that she had told the owner to take the signs down.  This is probably some violation of the law.  But, we were hungry.  So, I decided not to make a fuss about it.  

We ended up ordering the crab sandwich, which the waitress claimed was the best thing on the menu.  We couldn't verify that.  After waiting for half-an-hour, the waitress told us that they were all out and that the kitchen failed to tell her this fact when she was taking our order.  We had also ordered some appetizers, and a steak.  So, we decided to share that instead and eat something else later.  I felt sorry for the waitress.  It wasn't her fault.  The kitchen and service staff obviously have some communication problems.  And, the management obviously refuses to do anything about it.  Also, it is surprising that we arrived at like 7:30 on a Saturday and they were already out of the top seller on the menu.  It is like they did not plan to serve food at all that day.

So, you might think, top seller.  Maybe it sold out quick.  However, my friends tried to order other things from the menu like grilled chicken, which does not require any advance prep.  They were also out of chicken.  How do you run out of chicken at 7:30 on a Saturday.

The waitress informed us that they had just hired a new cook and that they were having some transition problems.  In fact, she pointed him out as the skinny, dirty looking guy at the bar, smoking and drinking with the other customers.  Meanwhile, we were still waiting for the food that we previously ordered.

We were very hungry.  They didn't even serve bread.  After a while, we had to ask because no food was coming.

This was not the waitresses fault.  The drinks we ordered came right away.  They have a large selection of imported and domestic draught and bottle beers and the prices were reasonable.  Some imported draughts were under 5.  Some were over 8.  So, there was a range.  I appreciated the variety.  And, overall, the beer was tasty.  So, concludes the highlight portion of our tour.

When the food arrived, it was not very good.  The steak was tough.  It was overcooked.  My friend ordered a hanger steak that looked smaller than the palm of his hand.  We all laughed when we saw it.  My friends ordered the shrimp cocktail and they seemed to like that.  But, everything else was disappointing.  We all did our best not to have that be a focus of the meal.  But, it was kind of like driving through a cow pasture and trying your best not to react to the smell.  There was an uneasiness that permeated the meal.

We go the check.  The waitress graciously took a few items off the bill to compensate for what was a horrible dinning experience.  But, she was great.  The place is cash only.  But, there was an ATM inside.

This place has a lot of potential.  It has a great location.  The high ceilings are covered with beautiful moldings.  The wainscoting on the walls looks very classy.  The place is large.  It looks like a good place to have classy meals or to have a fun place to appeal to tourists.  This is unfortunately neither.  It feels like a dive bar.  The patrons seem to like getting drunk in peace.  It doesn't seem particularly busy.  The low lighting makes the place feel dirty somehow.  And, the music was just horrible.  You end up shouting because the syncopated chording makes you want to fill the air with anything, but his music.

If this was just a bar, without food and music, I might be tempted to give it 3 stars.  There were a lot of good beers on tap.  But, unfortunately, this place does a lot of things too poorly to ignore.  So, one star.
author: Andrew W.

description: Bartender just plainly  ruined the little business it had coming in when he said sorry i can't take this ID,then gave me a disgusted look! hmm prolly cus is from Mexico, so. All 6 of us jut left to another Irish pub around the corner, which was way better!
author: Jonathan S.

description: Typical bar decor and atmosphere but a great selection of beers!  Friendly and helpful service.  If you want to try several beers have the sampler.  Limited selection of food.  I had a half-dozen of oysters which were delicious!
author: Bill H.

description:
I wish there is a 0 star option for this place.  It deserves it.

Took the family and the grandma to the aquatic park to watch the 7/4 fireworks.
Walked pass this place and saw the outdoor dining area. It looks like a nice place to have casual dinner.

Spoke to the waitress and was told that it's open seating, so just seat yourself.  She was frank about the 45 min wait for food.  Since we have some time, it is okay, picked a place and sat down.
Then folks at the adjacent table picked up and left.  Left, as in nothing on the table, completely vacant, void of any person or personal belongings, out of sight. So we move over to their smaller table since we were only 2 adults, 1 senior and a baby.
Our waitress came over to clean the said table and give menus, all is normal and well up to when we were getting ready to order.

Then this all went to hell really fast.
At this point, the folks that left came back, demanding their table back. Huh??
Another waiter came out and instead of mediates or offers alternatives to defuse the situation, decided to side with folks that left.  After a few arguments with no real solution but only insults from the waiter, we were rudely asked to leave. At this point, our baby feel threatened and start to cry, we no longer feel this place is worth the trauma, and got the hell out of there.
I guess service rating would be negative since we got none but insults. And food rating would be zero.

1. Instead of open seating for the outdoor area, I rather you just put up a sign to ask "wait to be seated".  But wait...I did ask and was told it's okay to sit there.  Even clean the table for us...  I guess waiter trumps waitress here??
2. When you have an unfortunate situation between two patrons, instead of exacerbate the situation, maybe you could try some old fashioned customer service and find a solution?

After reading some of the reviews for this place, I don't think this place give a flying f**k about customer or service.  They get enough foot traffic from the tourists that no repeat customers needed.
I liked "real drink, real food, real people" scribble you had on the wall.   But I am just real shocked and real insulted.
I will avoid this place like the plague.
author: Customer Z.

description: Horrible wings. Also they didn't have the first beer I ordered, the root beer my son ordered or the shoe string fries or the steak fries we ordered. Once our food was on the table we didn't see the waitress again until we flagged her down to pay. It's not worth it even for the beer.
author: Stefanie S.

description: Good place to pop in and get a beer not sure about anyting else it was early when I was there.  Everyone appeared either sleepy or wore out from the night before.
author: William B.

description: This is your typical pub.  They have a wide variety of beer, and we ordered the sliders which were pretty good.  They only accept cash, FYI.
author: Mo D.

description:
So what happened to de Bears today?

...and what the hell was I doing in a testosterone-fueled Irish sports bar in the most touristy part of town, Fisherman's Wharf, on Super Bowl Sunday? Was I dazed and confused...or did I have a momentary surge of machismo insecurity...or did I just get hungry after looking at a queen?

Well, it turns out a bit of all three since I just finished spending the afternoon with my friend waiting for the deluxe Queen Mary II ocean liner to arrive into the bay. We were smelling Davy Jones' locker...or at least his gym socks...on the crescent pier in Maritime Park. Instead of defaulting to our stand-by, In-n-Out, we both acknowledged a hankering for a bowl of clam chowder. And thus, Jack's happened to be on our route.

When you walk in, it looks like a regulation sports bar with a smaller-than-average TV screen above the bar. But then you have to take an odd turn toward the right to find the extended beer bar and then make a sharp left to get to the dining area where it looked like lunch hour at the Shady Pines Retirement Home. Given a circuitous route only Marco Polo could figure out, I thought for sure we would be ignored. And I was right, but once we told the bartender upfront that we needed menus, the service improved.

Our sweat-shirted waitress was friendly and sadly seemed to be the only one serving all the tables. But we all persevered. The food, as it turned out, was mediocre. We ordered some popcorn shrimp, which came on a small plate and had the texture of a botched microwave job - overly moist and not crispy. It wasn't helped by the ketchupy sauce that seemed like only a distant relative to cocktail sauce. But who am I kidding?...we ate it all up.

Our bowls of chowder were good-sized and full of fresh clams, but the broth was quite watery, a bit of a letdown given that they flaunt how the Chronicle deemed theirs as the best chowder in the city. It did come with a big hunk of crusty sourdough bread, always a treat. Along with our drinks, the bill came to $32 for the two of us, a tad pricey...but it is the wharf after all.

The interiors are dominated by dark wood paneling and all shades of forest green with a most meticulously crafted ceiling. We were actually lucky to get the booth closest to the front bar since we could watch Prince's half-time show at the Super Bowl on the TV. Unfortunately I can't comment on the beers since I didn't have one this time, but they seem to have quite a few on tap. and no one seemed particularity disappointed with the selection.

FOOD - 2.5 stars...passable fare though the chowder disappoints
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...typical Irish bar except for the zig-zag route to the dining area
SERVICE - 3 stars...once the rescue party found us, we were fine
TOTAL - 3 stars barely...and only because my expectations were so low for a place on Fisherman's Wharf
author: Ed U.

description: Was really surprised to find a decent bar/grill so close to pier 39 that had surprisingly good food @ really reasonable prices. Bartenders where super friendly. oh ya did I mention they have like a gazillion beers on tap.
author: Adam G.

description: 68 beers on tap, $1 oyster shooters! What a great place. Jack's was busy but I never had to wait for a drink. I love Weyder's Pear Cider and they had it on tap. Great place!
author: Jessie G.

description:
AMAZING on tap beer selection! (and super inexpensive)!

Great divey atmosphere but lots of space - definitely not cramped! 

If you are looking for a fun ambiance and you like the dive bar scene, post up at Jack's!
author: Jaclynn F.

description: Came here last Thursday after work around 5pm. It wasn't very busy. It was my 1st  time here. The live music was really cool!...But, the bartender made me feel uncomfortable after I asked to charge my phone. They charge $7 for a pint of beer, and she implied people charging phones was expensive for the business...Wow! I work in the same building and was looking for a local place to have a drink before heading home. After my first beer was done, I sat for 10 minutes before I was checked up on. I had to flag the bartender down to ask for a food menu. She seemed annoyed. I decided to take my businesses elsewhere. Go to red jack saloon. $5 pints everyday and friendly, down to earth employees. I rarely write reviews, but I felt compelled to steer people clear of this kind of nonsense. I seriously contemplated walking back to retrieve the dollar tip I left. Not sure I've ever done that.... Maybe she was having a bad day but damn, I'll never come here again.
author: Srl L.

description: Beautiful and surprisingly spacious interior and 68 draft beers including a variety of IPAs, lagers, porters, ciders, and pilsners. There's a pool table and one arcade cabinet in the back. The bar is CASH ONLY but there are ATMs available.
author: Erin S.

description: Stumbled upon Jacks Bar on a Sunday afternoon. Good place to hang out at the bar and watch the game. Bartender was friendly and talented. My friends and I ordered the Bloody Mary with the works. Seriously, the best Bloody Mary I have had....ever. Also came with olive, cocktail pickle, cheese, cube of ham...practically a meal in itself. A little pricey but well worth it.
author: Laurie C.

description:
Since my friend really likes beer, what better place than Jacks for a large variety?  Well when I walk in, it is busier than when I was last there, but luckily there were a few stools open at the bar.  It's always nice to sit at the bar, maybe watch some sports or just sit and talk with friends and the bartender. Like last time Dara was the man who served us the beer. We actually got a lesson in what a snake bite vs black velvet. When my friend ordered a snake bite which they thought was a Guiness and pear cider, Dara told us that it was called a Black Velvet. A snake bite is lager and pear cider. Well either way since I never tried it, I was down. It was pretty good, but a little sweet for me near the end.  Too much sugar equals possible hangover when consuming mass amounts of alcohol. haha

Later since it was my choice I made my friend take a shot of Jameson whiskey and a pint of Guiness in one hit. Oh how I love the combo.  Drank a few other beers including Pabst beer since I have seen it in the last 2 movies I've watched. Pabst is a fairly light and smooth beer.  I'll be back down to Jacks soon for anyone who wants to go. If I lived in the city I'd hit their happy hour.  You would miss it if you didn't see the small sign near the employee area.
author: Chris G.

description:
I went here at 12:30 on a Saturday.  The bar had a sign outside saying $3 drafts and $1 oysters.  The bartender said that the kitchen was not open.  When we asked what time it opened he said, "when the cook gets here."

His unhelpful attitude would have been fine if they weren't actually charging $15 for a jack and coke and one pint of beer.  I mean, really?  The bartender also ran out of Racer 5 and Jack Daniels.  How do you run out of Racer 5 at a bar in San Francisco on a Saturday morning?

We were there for at least two hours and the kitchen never seemed to open.  They were nice enough to let us bring something in to eat, though.

I would definitely give this place another try, though.  It's really large and actually a beautiful space.  From what I could tell,l the menu was limited, but it looked like they had oysters and sausages.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Good spot to visit if you are in the Fisherman's Wharf area. We were looking for a place to watch our buckeyes play football and get some breakfast at 9am. One of the few places open that early so you can watch a noon east coast game. Their breakfast is super reasonable ($5), however the staff is less than desirable. They have one cook, and  one server and one bar tender in the AM. As long as you know that going in it is no biggie.

We went back there at night and there wasn't much more service but the staff that is working was very friendly and prices are still reasonable, plus they have a bunch of flat screen TV's to watch all games on.
author: Dominic C.

description:
Good place

We like to go to Jack's for a few reasons:
1) Beer (in expensive)
2) Sports (they have a ton of TV's)
3) Outside seating or inside and always a table available.
4) Cheap burgers, not so bad if you are on a budget.

I like to play tourist, and this is very kid friendly, ice cream next door, everyone's happy!
author: Kristie H.

description: GREAT beer bar. Pretty much the only place in the Wharf area with any sort of craft beer selection. They have around 85 beers on tap. They accept cash only, so be prepared going in. I have never eaten here, but if it's excellent beer you're looking for, this is the place.
author: Leah A.

description:
You know what...a $6.50 pint of beer really DOES taste better! Oh wait, no it doesn't. It tastes exactly the same as a $4 pint. Damnit.

Despite the fact that the beers are ridiculously expensive, apparently Jack can't afford soap dispensers, toilet seat covers, or stall door maintenance in the women's bathrooms.


Beer prices = gross.
Bartender touching the tops of the straws with his dirty bar fingers = really gross.
Random chick puking in the bathroom on TWO separate occasions = typical, and gross.

The bartenders are damn cool, even though they're pretty stale. The brassy, older female bartender frightens me.  The hot British barkeep acted quickly when I informed him the Pyramid Apricot Ale was flat. He quickly had it changed and I was back in service.

The feel of this place is pretty cool - kinda divey, kinda quirky, but - alas, it's in the Wharf so you'll pay double.  All in all, it was still a good time and I met a couple good looking out-a-towners there who ended up buying my expensive beers for me.

Bring cash (no credit cards accepted), bring an ID, bring Lysol for the bathroom - and a strong stomach if the sound of yaking gets to you.
author: Fräulein J.

description: The steak was absolutely De-licious...The bloody mary was off the hook.... Im goin back!
author: Bigtime D.

description:
service was mediocre because there was only one gal taking / delivering orders, busing tables, collecting payments (in cash). so, there was a wait...but she was good at covering lots of ground.

we ordered simple breakfasts:  

- one sausage w/ scrambled eggs,came w/hash browns and toast (one slice!) - it was alright.  second refill of coffee was not hot. 

- one breakfast sandwich, the only way it comes - scrambled egg / cheese, sausage. on a scrumptious round bun. the bun was abt 4 inches wide, the sausage patty was like a jimmy dean slice abt 2 inches...where's the meat!!!  but it was good. would have been REALLY good if there were 2 slices of sausage or if the sausage was 50% larger.

good prices on the menu posted on the front door were an incentive to come in for breakfast.
author: Diane C.

description:
Yes, 75 beers on tap but completely not worth it. 

This was our final stop on a night out and it definitely killed the mood. Although the bartender was friendly and very helpful (blond with an Irish accent), I didn't like the ambiance of the place. At 11:30 PM on a Saturday, it was DEAD! 

We sat at the corner end of the bar and there seemed to be a peculiar odor emanating from somewhere (wet mop smell?). I couldn't wait to get out of there. 

Another tourist trap. 

Cash only.
author: Cassie M.

description:
Good spot for the cannery/fisherman's wharf area if your looking for craft beer. 

Usually its between 65-85 beers on tap. Place gets usually packed during weekends and/or baseball/football games. Took some friends here to showcase the most beers on tap that I know of in the bay area. Dope spot, love the interior. Classic SF lifestyle to me.

They do have food, but i recommend getting it elsewhere located anywhere near Jacks. 

btw, CASH ONLY.
author: David P.

description:
What the heck, when you come in here pretty much expect the following:
 1. Mediocre customer service-she was nice but SLOW!
 2. A long list of Customers CAN NOT do things on the menu
 3. NO credit cards!
 4. They tell you to expect a long wait
 5. Very little things on the menu, by the way the steak on the menu looked nasty with side of frozen vegetables and baked potato
 6. Very good clam chowder!
 7. Ok string fries
 8. Burger looked ok nothing fancy and does not come with fries
 9. Chicken wings- Decent not much meat on them though
 Hmm tourist trap, very pricey!
author: Karen T.

description: Jacks was recommended by a few people for my first visit to SF. Well I gave it two tries and neither time did I manage to even get so much as a drink. Both times I walked in. No one was there to greet so we sat our selves at one of the high tops by the bar. After a few minutes of not getting service I tried going to the bar. One bartender and lots of empty drinks. Not worth the hassle. The live music sounded good and I wish I could have got something to drink and spent more time there.
author: Cameron C.

description: Overpriced, cash only and lackluster service. Go to the Blue Mermaid next door instead.
author: Jon T.

description: We love this Bar.  Great location, great selection of beer and really friendly bartenders.  If you are from out of town or a neighborhood local a definite must CHECK OUT
author: Stephanie M.

description: Best bloody mary ever!  Beer selection is also awesome.  Didn't try the food.
author: Karina S.

description: Stopped here while taking a walk around San Francisco.  Sat outside and enjoyed a nice cold Pear cider.  It was peaceful and relaxing!
author: Puja L.

description:
Came here after going to Lombard Street. Needed some beers after all of those hills!

What a selection of beers! Loved every pint I had, especially the pear cider! Bar had a really chill vibe, comprised of locals and tourists. Prices weren't bad either. I'd definitely go back!
author: Chrim K.

description: nice place , cool bartender , had a nice time here , good juke box, nice location , thumbs up
author: Jack C.

description:
I got sloppy drunk here for my 21st birthday!

Okay this is how the day started my hubby and I woke up went for breakfast.  Then we went to Alcatraz, cus my hubby had never been!!  Obviously we're not from SF.  So I "excitedly" have a beer at each location.   Then we wind up here for an 3:00  drink.  (this was before I knew about yelp and all the bars that I could have tried.) Anyways,  I wanted to drink a lil then go back to the hotel, put something skimpy on, and go dancing!!!!  Um no, it kinda didn't end up that way.

We sit at the bar.  And my hubby is impressed with all the beers they have on tap.  The bartender didn't even card me. :(  "You mean I've been using a fake id for nothing!"  

So the day progresses and the bartender found every imaginable mixed drink with Jagger in it.  
"MMM... I like the red bull with it,  oooh, the Jagger and coke is good..."

By this time my hubby and I had made friends with the entire bar.  Including the 2 college boys that played, "Here Comes my Girl" by Tom Petty.  Awww so sweet.  And this ugly, man faced woman that sat at the bar alone.  Now I'm all for chicks hitting the bar by their lonesome.  That's exactly why I started talking to her.  La La La we're talking, and I'm getting more drunk by the sip.  

Here it is 8:00 p.m. FIVE *AFTERNOON* HOURS LATER!!!  
I'm walking around bare foot!  I called my mom and dad outside sitting hunched over on the curb to let them know that their baby girl was having a good time. I go to the bathroom several times not to go pee pee, but to throw up.   Then the ugly, lonesome manly girl comes in to see if I'm "okay."  I tell her yeah, "cus even belligerent I don't need any chick to *hold my hair*. "  I come back out to the bar ready to have another shot, and my hubby looks at me and says we have to go.  What?! Why?!  "um because that girl tried to kiss me!!"  

WHAT!!!!!!!?????  THAT JAY LENO CHIN, ARKANSAS OKIE, FAKE CARING BITCH!  Okay so she may of been a lil cute.  

So we leave.  And my hubby literally has to carry me to our car that is parked a few blocks away.  By this time I am crying, yelling, drunk, and yes still bare foot!!  He tells me to calm down, because a cop was driving by; and he didn't want it to look like he was kidnapping me; but I keep going with my antics; and he doesn't stop us.  I guess that sight is normal for SF?!  :)  

We get to our hotel, and I'm still upset that some girl tried to kiss my husband on my 21st birthday.  Actually I think I'm still mad.  

Bottom Line, "thanks jacks for a great time!"

Oh in case you didn't get it, minus one star for ugly girl.
author: Nichole M.

description:
Had a great time here. They had many beers that I simply cannot get in the valley. Good service, didn't have food but it looked good. Everything was reasonably priced.

Cash only!!
author: Andrew F.

description: The service at this bar is terrible. We were excited to try as outside $1 oysters and $10 crab seafood platter were advertised. We came inside, sat down, and waited 15 minutes and no server was in sight. Finally my husband went to the bar as that seemed to be the only place any serving staff were congregating. He ordered drinks but decided food wasn't worth the trouble it was taking to get. At the same time, a server came to the table as I was waiting for my husband to get back and yelled "HEY!....HEY!..." to get my attention and shouted "you okay?!" Very professional and helpful. Only giving 2 stars for the location and live music but otherwise this place is terrible.
author: Marnie E.

description: The waiter was friendly and engaging, giving us a description of each of the beers we asked about. The raw oysters were delish, came out relatively quickly and the cocktail sauce was tasty! Overall the prices of beer were reasonable for being in a touristy part of San Fran. When I am in the area and want a beer this is the place I will go!
author: Matilda N.

description:
Had the "Batch 19" -- very good.

Many beers, but prices are not cheap.

Service average.

Excellent place for groups. Decor interesting -- in a good way.
author: Harry S.

description: Not a bad place. Most beers are $6 and they have about 30 or so craft beers on tap which is very nice. Lost a 4th star because they only take cash and the waitress cashed us out when her shift ended at 8pm. Also because when I asked for bar nuts I got tiny bag of planters. Wtf? Good bar and beer. Live guitar singer was nice too.
author: Jonathan L.

description: A great old world dive bar, with amazing architectural features from a bygone era. Two bars (one cash, one full) and a seating area. One pool table in the back. Service is on par with a dive bar. Cool spot in the Wharf.
author: Jeremiah K.

description: Kind of smells, service was average. No soap in the bathroom. Cash only. Was not impressed .
author: Jay T.

description: I went to Jack's on a first date to watch the 49er playoff game.  It wasn't over crowded like I expected.  We got great seats at the bar right near two tv's.  I was impressed by the choices in beer, wow!  The bartender wasn't over friendly but he was pleasant.  The other patrons were friendly and chatty so that added to the fun.  From what I could see of the food, not impressed, you might want to eat before you get there or afterward.  The one downer was they only accept cash.  Who carries cash anymore?!   Their ATM machine in the bar was on the blink so we only had a few beers each, what our cash on hand would allow.  Overall it was a nice place, cool building and fun atmosphere.
author: Connie G.

description: I would give it a -1 if there was an option. Stopped in yesterday for a $4.75 breakfast sandwich as advertised by the sandwich board sitting outside the front door. WORSE. SERVICE. EVER. The waitress did not greet me, did not take my order, acknowledged me long enough to take my money, and proceeded to not thank me or smile, but rather start an entire conversation with another employee. I will not be back. I will continue with my $3.25 daily sandwhich from the awesome Starbucks around the corner from Jacks next to  Walgreens. They have a great morning crowd that goes out the door, in part due to the fact that they smile when you walk in, thank you for the order, and tell you to have a good day.
author: Aimee G.

description: I guess for the location it's about as good as you could hope for.  I don't understand how a bar this large is cash only, but they are.  Yes, they have a lot of beers on tap, but at least 12 of those are crappy lite beers, so I wasn't really that impressed.  The service was ok.  The tv's were not adequate for going to watch a game you actually cared about.
author: David P.

description:
They have a big selection of beers on tap which enticed me to stop by.

The bartender was nice and friendly; she forgot to ask me to pay for my drink though and never really came back to ask if I wanted more.

What turned me off was that they don't accept credit cards and that a regular beer was $6.50. Mad expensive!

I got the pear cider and it was nice and refreshing. I wanted to try something else but not at the price of $6.50
author: Lara L.

description:
Beer here is expensive - $6.75 for draught. They do have a lot of choices though.

We were here in the middle of a Saturday afternoon and they weren't very busy. Even so, our waitress wasn't very attentive and it took forever to get any kind of service.

The menu is pretty limited and reminds me of something you would see in a small town greasy spoon in the middle of the MidWest or something like that. I wasn't very impressed.
author: Carrie T.

description:
Perfect dive bar to jump into after a day doing touristy stuff on the Embarcadero. $3 PBR pitchers and $1 oysters - what more could a girl want?

Crowd was a pleasant mixture of tourists, locals and homeless folks, but who cares. An hour in here and everyone's smiling.

Service was friendly without being pushy or cheesy or knob-like as so many other places in this area are.
author: Kym P.

description:
65 beers on tap - 5 Stars
Jane the Bartender - 5 Stars
Garnishes with a bloody Mary - 5 Stars
The cost of drinks - 1 Star

I almost fell over when I learned of the cost for a bloody mary and my beer, both $8.50.  A regular beer is $6.50.  I had almost left after my first drink, but for some reason stayed and had pretty great time.  Had it not been for the bartender, I would have left much earlier and not rated this joint as high.
author: Chris F.

description:
I have seen just about every bar up and down the wharf! This is a cool ass bar with a real bar style to it! Lived the Irish waitresses and great selection of beers on tap! 

Must stop but for a quick drink!
author: Allen C.

description: Stopped in on a quiet Monday night...only 6 other customers, each already had been served but it still took the bartender over 10 minutes to acknowledge us and take our order. Never offered a menu, wasnt very friendly. Then she overcharged us by double! When we called her attention to it, she was quick to put the correct change on the bar. Don't go there...they prey on the hapless tourist.
author: Melanie P.

description: Really cool chill bar. Would have given 4 stars if they took debit or credit cards. Cash only is kind of a pain sometimes.
author: Ann V.

description:
Eh. I came here after a day of spontaneously visiting random places in SF. We initially were going to eat at the Blue Mermaid next door, but changed our minds because of bad service. Instead we came here. And got .... incompetent service?

It was actually quite bizarre now when I think about it. We stepped inside, and it looked like nobody else was eating except us. Everyone else was drinking beer. They probably knew better. Our order was botched up inexplicably. We would order some items, and instead of getting exactly what we ordered, we got it back with something wrong, whether it be the wrong side, wrong dish, or wrong drinks, etc. And when we saw the bill at the end, it turned out our waitress took the order RIGHT. At what point in the "chain" exactly did our orders go so wrong? Weeeiiird.

At least they got a bunch of TVs around the place and the atmosphere was relaxed. They also got a BUTTLOAD of beers on tap here, an entire frigging walls worth. Pretty impressive when you look at it. Prices are ok to kinda pricy and based on our experience, a gamble to get the drink you want. At the end, we left somewhat unsatisfied and had to find a place to really SATISFY our hunger. Which meant good old In-N-Out right down the street. Perfect way to end our bizarre meal.

Verdict: Probably would never come back here for food. Ever. For drinks, maybe. If I feel like giving them a second chance.

CASH ONLY, so ... bring lots of cash?
author: Andrew M.

description: Went in on thursday before 49er game. Lounge area was nice.  Fried chicken was over cooked the burgers where good .Service was slow. And the place was empty.  Lots a beers on tap was a plus .
author: Joanna S.

description: It's every man, woman and child for himself in Jack's - but if you're in a good mood - this can be a great place to take a load off after a tourist-y rush through a few San Francisco "must-see's.  When you're showing the family from out-of-town the sights near the Pier - and your feet refuse to go one step further - drop in Jack's where they have a beer for every bone in your body.  LOL.  The selection is enormous, the rooms are cavernous - it has an olde tyme feel...and look.   The drawback for us was the waitress to hungry/thirsty guest ratio of 1 to 200.  But, we lived, we drank and we ate before perishing.  This was our goal.  They are cash only - but they have ATMs.  There's a friendly, comfortable feel in Jack's.  Great place for parties for all of your obnoxious friends.  My burger was good - simple, but good.
author: Liana R.

description: We came in so my husband could have a beer.  Excellent beer selections, cash only bar.  Prices are ok.  Love the atmosphere.
author: Brandy H.

description: I liked this place and so did boyfriend and boyfriends visiting companion from South Carolina. Huge selection of beers. Amazing and extremely old woodwork in the back. Random and awesome crowd of tourists and San Franciscan's alike. Overall, a great experience. I'd definitely go back.
author: Laila P.

description: Terrible place. Sonoma county born and raised, I ordered a lagunitas, and it tasted terrible - flat and stale! I brought it back and asked kindly (as someone who has worked as a waitress) if he served me the wrong beer. An abrasive "No." I tell him it doesn't taste right, and that I would like to change it out for a new one. Then he accuses me of not knowing what lagunitas tastes like and says he won't change it out and that I have to pay for a second beer! Needless to say, I talked to the owner, got my money back and left. This guy was literally screaming at me as we were getting our money back from the owner, and it was quite the scene. He definitely needs some anger management classes. I work next door right next door and am very disappointed, yet not surprised based on other reviews of this place. The Parlor next door is a much better option if your looking for drinks.
author: Laura T.

description:
This bar has your standard taxidermy deer head but also the added bonus of a ram and a water buffalo and an enormous fireplace.

I really don't hate it here...it's fun to stop in for a drink if you're in the area. Sunday nights are especially good because there are not too many people around and the jukebox is awesome.

I went for an Irish coffee last night and then a Bailey's and coffee...super delicious on a cold Sunday night, like a warm blanket. The bartenders were attentive and it had the relaxing feel of a neighborhood bar.
author: carrie c.

description: a must stop for any beer aficionado on a SF visit, i come here every time...though many of the taps are throw aways no beer lover will care for, ther are always a few interesting ones, and some Anchor, so while this is not the plethora of a NYC draft house, the chances are you'll have a great beer or two...the ambiance is fun-divey, withhundreds and hundreds of retired pulls to waken old memories...fun!
author: Dave H.

description:
While trekking through the herds of Tourists myself and two tourists from NJ were walking from Fisherman's Wharf to Ghirardelli's Square and my friend spots a sign touting 68 beers on tap. Since we were on a quest to find local beers we felt obligated to stop. 

This place is pretty big and open. They have booth seats in the middle of t the main room to separate the front from the back of the building. The bar was in the room on the right.

There was at least one pool table in the back and also some PGA golf game. 

The waitress we had was very attentive and always checked our  levels of beers as she walked past. 

Unfortunately, we didn't bother to check the price on beers which were something like 6.50 a pint. I know it's right in tourist central but really that's unnecessary. One pint a friend ordered was 8.00 bucks and we only found that out after we asked for the bill. Kinda lame. 

I'd go back again simply for the selection of beer but then again I'd have to pass up plenty of other places with beer on tap cheaper.
author: Alex R.

description:
Jack's is a good place for weary tourists (me) to stop in for a pint or two after walking up and down the Embarcadero all day. 

They have ample seating; We went in the mid afternoon and easily found a seat at the bar. The service was quick and the bartender was pretty knowledgeable about all of the beers on tap. Jack's is also a nice place to experience a variety of the local Bay Area beers. I tried the Old Foghorn, which was strong and tasty. 

Take the cable car or street car (both of which are 1-2 blocks away) to or from to check this place out!
author: Cameron B.

description: Stopped in for a few quick beers a our first night. Music was very loud when we went in but then moved around the corner to the 'snug' where it was quieter. Great selection of beers. Barman was very quick and attentive. Reminded me kind of a Key West type bar. Nice atmosphere, my kind of place.
author: Ross H.

description: Touristy dive bar? I guess that is the best way to explain Jacks. However it was a sight for my sore eyes and feet after a long day of walking. Tons of great beers on tap. Even had Dales Pale Ale in a can . SO GOOD. Great spot to rest up and grab a drink before continuing on our journey. Is this place a must see? No. Best service? No. BUT if your in the neighborhood and want to sit down and grab a quick drink with minimal crowds this is your place.
author: Helaana C.

description:
I am the type of person that doesn't write reviews but this place was so horrible that I actually made an account to write one.  
I wish I didn't have to give it a star.... I had always had a great time at this pub so I told my friends we should all try it out. When we get their we all go in so happy bc we knew it was going to b a great night.  Well the bartender started asking us all for IDs so when it came to my friend he just said we don't  accept Mexican visa.. I was in shock bc this is place is right by the piers where many foreigners go. Anyways two other friends had already ordered a beer so we were like ok we'll just chill and leave until they r done but then that f******** bartender told my friend he couldn't b there even thought this is a pub, a place  where families can actually go to. I will not be going to this place again. Seriously they lost many customers that night. 
To the management please make sure the people u hire are a reflection of San Francisco's diversity and are culturally humble.
author: Fina M.

description:
After a long day in Japan Town's Cherry Blossom festival and at the BYOBW 2009, my friends and I decide to stop at Jacks for some beer and food. 

Nestled right between the Ghiradelli Square and Hooters, this place has an excellent selection of beer on tap. I believe it's close to 80+ different types if beer on hand which was served by some friendly bartenders. I think the lady bartender was completely sloshed.

The food service however seemed to be a tad on the slow side as it took us a good amount of time to actually get any sort of service for almost empty restaurant. I ordered the fish & chip and clam chowder. The fish in the fish & chip was actually quite delicious but there was only 3 or 4 small pieces and the fries were a little soggy, nothing to write home about. The clam chowder bread bowl was a little weak. The chowder was pretty tastey but they used too much chopped celery as fillers. Take out the celery and it could be tons better.

The highlight of the night was BYOBW afterglow, good company, cold beers, and the fish. Nom nom nom. Oh, and the sloshed bartender.
author: Joon Y.

description:
I am completely flabbergasted that someone would say this bar lacks history.   This place is so much more than another Pier 39 tourist trap. The wood paneled walls and fireplace are absolutely gorgeous and historic, over 400 years old.  They were shipped to San Francisco to be installed in Hearst Castle, but when he died, the pieces stayed in the warehouse, part of which is now the back room of Jack's.  

Completely unexpected in a dive bar in a random part of Fisherman's Wharf, but it's quirkly little things like these that make me love San Francisco!  It made me sad that so many people seemed to cluster in the bar area, completely missing out on this amazing sight.  

Aside from that completely unique detailis which I feel  worth a trip in itself, the bartender was friendly, there was ample seating, and there is a lovely patio in the back.  I found the beer prices reasonable, but apparently I am in the minority here.  Can't vouch for the food, but there is pinball!
author: Jaimie M.

description: If you like your beers, This is good as it gets, over 60 beers on tap, reasonably priced. Big screen Tv's goin for the games, Food was delicious. Highly recommend this watering hole for respite from teh crowds!!!
author: Michael L.

description: Beers were plentiful & cold. Hit the spot. Food on the otherhand, STUNK. Overpriced, frozen food.
author: Tom S.

description: Amazing beer selection!!! 83 beers on tap or something like that!? Great stuff. It has a pretty laid back atmosphere, kinda older dive-y type feel. It's a little annoying they don't take cash, but at the same time kind of a fight the man type move. I had a Prohibition Ale from Speakeasy Ales and a burger. It was sorta cheap for a beer and burger, but extra for cheese? That sucks. The burger was fine, but not amazing. Which for $4 is fine I guess. I give it 3 stars  because a huge beer selection is awesome. However, the burger and fried I got just wasn't very special.
author: Joshua N.
