description: While the bartender was awesome, knowledgeable, and friendly about the beers, they were out of a ton of stuff and when we took a seat at a booth, we were faced with one of the most rude waitresses I've ever met. When we tried to joke with her, she kind of just ignored it. Someone please get that dark-haired woman a beer. Thanks.
author: April L.

description:
A friend and I came here on the prowl for one specific elusive creature.  The orange rimmed-Blue Moon.  In a funny twist of fate, that was the only beer too shy to show its face in the bar.  Irony is the spice of life.  With my urging, he settled for the more common great white as his kill.  It had a shark on the spout.  How cute is that?  

I was fortunate to find a creature I wasn't even hunting.  It was thought to be extinct.  Or at least too endangered be found at the beer zoo of Jack's, but there it was in all it's luscious foamy glory.  The raspberry cider on tap.  
I took my trophy to my lips thoughtfully, taking pleasure in the anticipation of the tingle on my tongue.  Then I poured the rest of it down my throat as fast as I could swallow, just so I could get another perfect pint of fizzy pink dew.  

For the next round I tried something more adventurous.  I mated the raspberry cider and a distant cousin of the cider, the raspberry stout.  It resulted in a sterile species no use to anyone, something like the mule.  Only this interbreed tasted like a fruity penny had been left in a can of coke too long.  A failure on my part but at least the bartender humored me enough to poor it.  

The raspberry cider on tap made our entire safari in the down pouring night of the San Francisco Serengeti in my soggy shoes completely worth it.
author: Shelley H.

description: We were hungry and this place didn't look as expensive as others in the area - although that probably wasn't good judgment as it was very expensive for what it was. We sat outside and the beer came in plastic cups, and was kinda cold. The fried prawns were good, the veggieburger was good. The chowder in a sourdough bread roll was okay, and the BLT... could have given up after a bite or two if I wasn't so hungry. Service was friendly enough.
author: George S.

description: 40 minutes to cook dry buffalo chicken wings. Lame. Will never come back.
author: Vladimir P.

description: Went in here for a drink and after she told me she couldn't give us tasters even though there are signs that say "we have tasters just ask"! I was annoyed. Then when she told me she couldn't honor the four square check in deal because they don't have a computer, we left! #majorfail
author: Vanessa L.

description:
We ate breakfast here 2/3 mornings we were in San Francisco.  Breakfast was great diner-esque style food (bacon, eggs, hashbrowns, and sour dough toast).  I ate almost everything and I'm not a big fan of breakfast, in general.    The best part of breakfast?  The 80 beers on tap!  There is nothing like beer and breakfast on vacation...

I'd love to give this place 5 stars, but the service did leave something to be desired.  The young woman (blonde) who was working our first morning there (just beers, as we'd had breakfast elsewhere) was the best of the staff we encountered.  She was polite and helpful and even poured me a taste of a beer (which is apparently a no-no there and is one of my pet peeves!).  She knew the most about beer of any of the staff we encountered, which is a bit of a let down for me (the others, not her) because I want to get some local insight on local beers when traveling.  

The older man we encountered the next morning was obviously not feeling well (and was actually replaced shortly after we ordered so he could go home), though he was nice, and I can't even remember the gender of his replacement, so (s)he obviously wasn't memorable.  The third morning we were even a bit later than usual (7:30) and we were told there was no one there working yet (despite the "OPEN" on the door along w/the posted 6AM open time and 7AM breakfast time).  As we were heading out, they told us to stay and just wait a few moments.  The young man who came in was very nice, but harried as it seems the prep work wasn't done and he was behind from the start.  He did not seem to be very beer knowledgeable.  

So, in reading that, I guess my issue is really w/management.  If you don't want to be open at 6, don't open at 6.  However, if you choose those hours, I'd like to actually feel welcome when I walk into your establishment (especially the THIRD morning in a row).  My other issue is, while they have a fantastic beer selection (I'd put it up close w/any other we encountered in San Francisco), they're not really a "beer" bar.  The beers aren't prominently posted anywhere, save table "tents" on the bar, some of which were inaccurate, and none of which provided ANY description of the beers.   I also have issue w/not allowing tastes.  I've never been to a "beer" bar that didn't allow tasting.  I'm even perfectly happy w/limiting tastes or offering a sampler flight for a fee, but neither of those options were offered.  

I love the decor; the old dark wood and ornate ceilings are truly gorgeous.  I also enjoyed all of the tap markers lining the top of the bar.  

Beer selection was impressive w/lots of local breweries represented (Anchor heavily so).  I was pleased to encounter a few IPAs I'd never seen/drank before and thoroughly enjoyed the Ninkasi (sp?) Tricerahops (Double IPA)....I may even go as far as to call it my favorite beer of the trip!

I would imagine it probably gets crazy busy here in the afternoons/evenings, but if you like good beer and old school diner style breakfasts for a reasonable price, this is the place to go for breakfast on the Wharf.
author: Summer K.

description:
$6.25 for a pint of beer in a plastic cup cash only?! WTF?

Found the place in a courtyard of a renovated Del Monte cannery off Fisherman's wharf while showing out of town friends around.  Thought we found the perfect oasis away from the tourist trappings of the area. We even had front row seats to a guy was playing acoustical guitar like he's the next Rodrigo Y Gabriela. 

Even my friend visiting from Germany who sees anything in dollars as "value priced" because of the exchange rate these days noted what a rip off it was.

Serves me right for even admitting that I was in such a touristy area...
author: David P.

description:
We were down at Aquatic Park for Fleet Week yesterday....
"Suckered" in because of the beer selection.
Waited about 15 minutes before anyone came to the table. 
I'm a patient person and I was with good friends.  I didn't really mind.  Mind you, the LISTLESS and LAGGARDLY SERVICE continued straight through till the end of the meal, which took about three times as long as what we would normally take for LUNCH.
Four top.
Three of the $9.99 T-bones.  (you'll definitely get what you expect)
Four sides with the steaks at $2.50 each. 
An order of fish n chips.
An order of wings.
Two Porters, two Black n Tans, six shots of Jamesons, and two Cokes.
Lunch bill.....
$160.
Fuck this place.
author: Barry A.

description:
On the walking tour of Fisherman's Wharf (http://www.sfcityguides.org/) we stopped in Jack's Bar.  We learned that the wood paneling was hand carved in the 1600s, and that it belonged to Mr. Hearst, (of Hearst Castle) who was keeping it in storage in SF for whatever reason.  I guess I forget the details because I was so mesmorized by the amazing hand carved fireplace and wall paneling.  

Later that same night, we stopped in for a beer.  It was 8ish PM on a Friday night, and was kind of expecting a loud noisy crowd.  I was extremely relieved to find it quiet and cozy instead (and rather emptyish).  The kitchen was closed but I didn't care, although it did seem early to close a kitchen to me.  

Unfortunately they did not carry my favorite beer among their 85 beers.  Too bad.  The convenience store down the street did, but that's another matter.  We enjoyed a couple of beers, chilled out near the fireplace, and walked back to the hotel.  

It was ridiculously expensive (to me, a non-city girl), but probably the norm for SF.  Cash only might be a nuisance to many, but at least they have an ATM on site.
author: Lisa M.

description: Please sell this place to someone who wants to stay in business! I came here some time ago, and recently returned.  I really like the beer selection- it can make you overlook the expensive prices in this place.  The clam chowder is pretty good too.  This place seems like it has awesome potential, but the people working here don't give a shit. It has the ambiance where you might expect a bunch of locals and tourists to mix. But sadly, no, not at all. This place could be a really good classic SF bar, if someone showed a little TLC.... sad in a way....
author: Jim B.

description: Love love love this place. Good service, friendly staff, a nice huge selection of beers on tap, and overall great time. Definitely reminiscent of any local bar. Very welcoming and they they've got some great food too. Definitely coming back.
author: Sabrina C.

description:
Came here on April 24th after a long morning of walking around to grab lunch.  I was enticed by the $1 oysters and a nice beer for lunch.

Overall you are better going elsewhere.  I only ordered 4 oysters to try them and wish I would have ordered only 1. They are small and not very good oysters.  i ordered a cold crab sandwich which pretty much came out as a mayo sandwich with a tiny bit of crab.  My wife had a subpar bowl of clam chowder.

The beer selection is great but the food and service had much to be desired.  It is also pricey for what you get. Would try elsewhere unless you want to sit outside which seemed to be a nice area.
author: Chris M.

description: As a customer I was absolutely apalled by the display of "ownership" in this bar. Service was decent and selection was satisfactory, but the staff was certainly less than pleasant. The bartender, off the bat, was short and looked irritated whenever he was asked a question. I'm sorry that I like some information before I order? Worst of all though was the owner, at least I guess that's who he was. The one in the hoveround thing? The delivery man came in and was pleasantly greeted with swearing and threats. 1. Why would you speak to someone in such a manner that is just trying to do their job? And 2. Why would you do such a thing in earshot of customers? Even if I were willing to return to this establishment for the FABULOUS service (sense my sarcasm?), I wouldn't consider it after that display. Greatest disrespect for no reason. Absolutely ridiculous.
author: Alyssa V.

description:
Out and about Jan 1st and was in great need of some comfort food.  Our thirst was overwhelming and our cravings were for beef n beer.  We saw this place in our travels the night before and thought to give it a try.  Getting a table was no problem as they didn't seem very busy.  

Upon entering this smell of cleaner came over us, not what I was expecting.   

After a bit the waitress took our beer order.  Took quite a while to see her again as we were almost done with our beers.  We placed our order and kicked back and enjoyed the flat screen tv Rose Bowl Game.  The fireplace made for a nice warm environment.

Our orders came right away I had to point out to the waitress that she got my order wrong.  :(   and NO i don't want to send it back and be wasteful, so i ate it as is.   Another in our party said something of the hamburger tasted odd but could not determine if it was the bun or the burger meat.  

We waited and waited to pay and go and finally had to go and find her as they said they would send her out.   Took her a long time to come out.  

I give 2 stars for the food and 1 star for the beer as it's kinda hard to screw up beer, as they have I believe 83 of them mmmMmmm
author: Roco j.

description:
Beer selection is overrated and taste like the taps haven't been cleaned in years.  The food is terrible, but that is a given.

Fail.
author: Lake C.

description:
The 85 beers sign got us in the door and chose to sit outside on a beautiful day and have a late 2pm lunch. 

It took over an hour to get our food, it was horrible. We even didn't get part of our order and was told they were busy inside, so the people outside might have to wait longer (that makes no sense). 

Our waiter kept telling another table about the country he was from and was too engaged in conversation that he was getting our orders wrong, forgetting to check on us and even gave 2 couples their orders and their check before we were even served when we were there before them and placed our orders before them. 

Bad service overall and the food was not great.
author: Joshua M.

description: Cold draft beer, comfortable atmosphere and friendly staff. This is truly a sports bar for any sports buff.
author: Kapena C.

description:
I love Jack's! It's a total dive bar, with many beers on tap. Prices are a little high for beer, but hey, not many places have as many choices as they do. They have Lost Coast's Great White beer! Pretty large bar, with pool and plenty of seating. Though the beer is great, I wouldn't go for the hard alcohol, as the bottles look dusty, and not for the food, since, well it may be a little scary. If you are hungry, just go to In and Out nearby. 

This bar gets really crowded during Fleet Week and decently busy on the weekend days. Nights seem to be slowish when I have gone. Perfect to get a table and your beer quickly. 

Bathrooms are ok. The women's reminded me of a high school bathroom, with many messages of "I love..." written inside the stalls. Seems like they painted over it, but I would not be surprised if it were started again. 

Cash only, but there is an ATM there.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
There were some very interesting people in this place. And since we've seen them all (at least I'd like to think we have), we stayed to enjoy a beer. Be aware though, they only take cash here, which was probably the only place in San Fran where we experienced this. 

Anyway, they have a HUGE selection of beer but don't be fooled, this place is just an ordinary bar.
author: Cathy S.

description:
The tune of 85 beers on tap is a siren call to my ears.....

But still.....

I almost feel as if I'm being stingy with my star rating. I'd like to give it  a two and a half, even 2 1/4 because I have to admit the whole 85 beer thing and the smoking patio outside are big perks.

Still though.....

There is no ambience in here. No style, no zip, nada. There's no lively energy of enthusiastic tourists nor a trace of sulking brooding drunks sipping the day away in a place where time doesn't exist. There's no sense of history, there are no characters working behind the bar. I'd like to blame Fisherman's Wharf for this over sight and say that SF sanitizes it's bars near the touristy spots but then I remember a few other bars centrally located in prime tourist spots (Union Square, other parts of Fisherman's Wharf/ Embarracadero,  etc). They have characters, charisma and charm (or lack there of). I'd find more personality at a TGI Friday's for chrissake! I have a feeling I could get tanked here and still not find it interesting. 

So yeah 2 stars....

Plus I have to be honest, it's kind of hard for me to justify the whole $6 pint thing in a place like this to my wallet.
author: Veronica G.

description: I LOVE this bar! its got to be one of my favorites that i always go to when i am in sf. I always see family's and kids and great people there. great service and the waitresses are friendly .great prices lots of different beer to try and choose from. Apricot beer pear cider and others as well.
author: Kristy D.

description: Jack's used to be reeaally cool,...back in the 90's! They had a cheap happy hour ($2 guiness and bud) but now it has sucumbed to rising rents,a bad economy, and commercialism. It's now touristy and expensive! If you need a drink, go down columbus to kennedy's pub!!
author: Kevin B.

description: I started coming here in 1997, and I love it. If you want a beer and want to chill near tourism but not in the middle of it, come to Jack's. Right off Ghiradelli near the Fisherman's Wharf area, it's a great location. The beers on tap go for miles, and anytime I know anyone coming to San Francisco, I send them to Jack's!
author: Devon A.

description:
First of all, a huge drawback that this bar is in Fisherman's Wharf. However, easy street parking since most tourists are walking around. It was pretty dead when I went, and this was on a Friday night. 

The only reason I decided to go to Jacks was the huge selection of beer listed on their website. The beers tasted alright, but personally not worth $6 a pint. Beers are $3.25 during happy hour, which is extremely early (from 3 - 5pm I think). Don't think I'll be returning unless for some bizarre reason I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Cathy C.

description:
I used to be the Activities Coordinator for Hostelling International. I brought a group of hostelers from Fort Mason here a few years back. It was cool. We were at Lou's first, indulged in Happy Hour drinks, apps and live Blues. After a while we realized it was way to loud and scooted on over th Jack's for some peace and conversation.

Jack's is cool, but the staff that day were kinda rude. I'm giving it an extra star for the beer selection as it's quite extensive. 

Turns out the bartender ripped one of the girls a new one for not tipping! I know it's gotta be frustrating working in such a tourist infested area of the city. I'm sure this happens a lot. But shit woman, YOU work in a tourist infested bar in tourist infested Fisherman's Wharf in tourist infested San Francisco!!! There are plenty of other bars you can work in! We all make choices in life, suck it up!! She nearly made the poor girl cry. I'm a strong believer that the way to getting things your way is by being nice and helping people. If she had just found a nice, polite way to confront the girls, I'm sure they would have been happy to drop some extra cash her way. Instead, she completely set a bad tone and contributed to what started off as a very awkward experience.

We got over it though, hope the bartender did too.
author: alexa c.

description: I'm a big fan of Anchor beers this place has 7 anchor beer on tap plus 70 others, the waiter wasn't as friendly but who cares they have the best selections of beer on tab, its right on fisherman warf and worth trying
author: Nader M.

description:
Great place, loved the live music for the 4th.  The list of 85 beers on tap is great, but stick to those instead of mixed drinks, which can take a long time to get since bartenders are often busy.

Ladies, watch out for the looooong wait on busy days- there are 3 stalls but one without a door.

Bar is cash only as well.
author: Tracy D.

description:
Good selection of beers, nice sunny seating outdoors and unpretentious attitude.  Allowed a SF resident a brief respite from tourists along the main drag of Fisherman's Wharf.  Service was good, cash-only policy was clearly marked (plus I know of at least two or three major bank ATMs in the area so if you want to walk a block or two, you can avoid the $2 convenience fee) and we had a decent time.  

Three stars only, though, A) because we had to ask for water, and a refill, when it was obvious we were having lunch,  and not just drinking beers, B) menu could be expanded a bit, and C) clam chowder was bland and milky.  Had to add copious black pepper and salt to make it palatable.  Bread, however, was delish and plentiful.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Jacks has the best bloody marys hands down. Nikki the bartender here is fantastic. She makes the bloodiest of the bloody- straight up. She rocks. Come see her!!!!!!! 
Love Nicole and Lily
author: Nicole H.

description: Shop in the little shops and then go get a beer at this place. It's a typical beer bar. They have several and by several I mean plethora of beer choices. Beer choices are anywhere from local to seasonal. The service is quick and friendly. An acoustic guitarist was playing while we enjoyed a local brand beer. Make sure you look up and check out the numerous taps they have decorating the ceiling.
author: Heide E.

description:
At first we were mesmerized by the wide variety of beer on tap... but service was completely lacking... and cash only?! 

Oh and the large groups of drunkards belting to Journey's "Don't Stop Believin" in the middle of the afternoon didn't help either. 

Meh so no thanks.
author: Sandy K.

description:
Slow, pricey, hostile. A disaster that exists because of tourist traffic and a boast of 80-something beers. Our story:
We're a bunch of eight 40-ish guys celebrating a friend's birthday. After a long day chasing each other through the city on a spy adventure, the birthday boy wants to treat his pals to a beer and maybe grab a bite of early dinner.
Group inertia leads us to Jack's outdoor area ("Where do you want to go?" "I dunno, where do you want to go?") Big mistake.

1. Some of our party start to shift a small patio table over so we can all sit together. A server shouts "No! No!" at us like he's disciplining a dog. We should've left right then. *sigh*
2. We sit and jaw for a while at our separate tables. I notice how much time has passed with no sight of a server. I don't usually notice this sort of thing. This was our best chance to escape.
3. I'm reading the menu posted on a column next to me and I see that Jack's is a cash-only place. I announce this to our group as our server finally shows up. The birthday boy does some quick counting in his wallet as the server suggests that they have two convenient ATMs on-site at $3 per transaction. How thoughtful.
4. We float the idea of ordering a pitcher and the server lady counters that by the glass is a better deal. Huh?
5. We place our drink orders and wait and talk... and wait... I wonder if they are brewing our beer to order. I notice that the young couple with a stroller who sat after us is looking a bit impatient and checking their watches. The promise of beer keeps us seated.
6. Finally! Beer! Our server arrives with a tray of little 12-oz sampler-sized solo cups. Seriously? I down mine in two pulls. Later, one of our group mentions that he's "never been served beer in a urine sample cup before." Funny, but he's not too far off.
7. A friend ordered iced tea and, considering how things have been going, has to ask if he's got refills on his tea. The server scrunches her face and replies reluctantly "I'm supposed to say 'yes', but don't go wild." Oh. Yes. Please don't go all chugfest on the free refills of iced tea.
8. The young couple has had enough and they leave.

We finished our beers/iced tea, paid our $48 (cash), and walked away to find a place that could make us feel good about spending our money instead of making us feel like we were being anally probed.
author: Phil D.

description: Perfect little bar.  Really big place, but it was late on a Sunday night so pretty empty.  Bartender was really nice, extremely friendly and made REAL DRINKS.  Tab was nothing compared to the drinks we had.  Juke box, TV's, drinks, had everything for a couple of hours to hang out and end the night.  Have some great pictures of the night....wish I could say I remember them.  Thanks for a great time and will put on the list as a spot to hit when I'm back in town!!!!
author: Rich F.

description: The beer on tap was a great selling point. However, the service was really poor in both attention as well attitude. Prices were very high, combined with the cash only policy that is just irritating.  Amazing potential, but not with this management.
author: John G.

description:
i was sort of asking for it by walking into a bar that claims to be famous in a touristy area of a city, but it turned out okay in the end. 

After a long day of hiking in Yosemite the day before, walking around town had really worn me out and my sunburn was getting progressively worse, so i had to duck inside.  A sign advertising lots of beers on tap was good enough enticement for me.

Strangely for a beer bar, the bartender boasted of not knowing anything about beer.  He claimed he was new.  i opted for Bear Republic's splendid Racer 5, which went down easy while i rested my weary feet and caught up on some messages.  The bar certainly has a lot of character, and seems to be pretty serious about beer, but at the same time, i didn't get the impression that it was a place that locals go.  i suppose in that case, i'm part of the problem.
author: Rob C.

description: Hands down the best Bloody Marys I have ever had!!!
author: Ang x.

description:
For a dive and half - it's perfect!  Never been able to find another place with so many beers on tap!
Been here many a times... not a place you go for romantic date, or to meet guys/girls, but they have a jukebox with good tunes, and like I said - the beer, I think the latest count is 110 beers on tap.  You go to have good beer and a fun time with friends...
yeah, people say it's dirty - and it kinda is, but it's a dive bar/pub with great and hilarious bartenders and one more time - a lot of beer!
Great for all my fellow dive bar lovers, not so great for the folks who only like to party in the marina, or around the corner at Dirty Martini.
author: Kris I.

description:
Very good on tap beer selection.  (I'm a beer snob so it only gets a very good).  Very friendly service.

Hopfishead 90 minute IPA on tap.  That is a fantastic selection.  A 9% Imperial IPA (double to triple). 

Definitely on my list to come back to.
author: Kim O.

description: Lots of beers bad service and waaay too expensive.  If you think this is a dive bar, you have never been to a dive bar. We didn't get any food but got a couple beers and still dropped almost $20.
author: Jerad D.

description: Best bloody marys ever for the ones who do not like a vast variety of micro brews and other fine brews
author: Brent K.

description:
One of the best things about Yelp is that when you find a place like this you can give it the proper review. 
I am fairly easy to please but this place did everything incorrectly.
1) Happy Hour goes from 3 to 5 (who gets off then???)
2) No, we do not take credit cards BUT we do have an ATM machine over there that charges $2 (and your bank charges $2)
(note that I hate carrying cash and rarely go to  places that choose to be cash) 
3) The bathroom had air dryers. The only air dryer that I think is not annoying is the one in Kennedys.
4) We asked for a bill and the staff seemed really annoyed. 

Normally I do not go out in this part of town and this sort of says why...
I ended up eating next door as they DO accept credit cards...
author: Marcus R.

description: Went here for lunch. Lousy service! After about 20  minutes a waitress finally asked if we needed anything. Asked for menus for lunch. Took her about 10 minutes to bring back the menus. About 2 minutes later she asked if we ready to order. We told her no and asked her to return in awhile. Guess we should have been more specific about time! She never returned! We informed another employee that we were ready to order but nothing came of that either. We finally left at this point.
author: Carol S.

description:
This is my favorite place to hang in San Francisco.  The people are great, you can't beat it's laid back atmosphere and the beer selection is fabulous!

Sal, Alex and Paul are friendly.  Willing to talk about the beers, the weather or whatever!  It is a cash only bar...and that's fine with me.
I was here 15 years ago, 10 years ago, this weekend, and next time I go to San Francisco.
author: Rosemary M.

description: Arrived in SF on business and was looking for a place to hang and have a beer, or eight;^/  Jacks was just down the street from my hotel, which is fortunate since I spent quite a bit of time in there.  68 beers on tap with a "strictly enforced" 40-beer limit!  I could only make it up to 34:^(  All kidding aside, I loved this bar....the dark wooded paneling, the tin ceiling tiles, brick, and fireplace all made for a warm and inviting place.  The icing on the cake was Jack's dining manager, Jane...as beautiful as they come!  Got to know her better as the week went by and wish I lived nearby.
author: Steve P.

description: it feels like a really old established bar. a bit of an older crowd. didn't seem like there were too many tourists when i was there. lots of beer on tap. lots of places to sit. good place to stop for a drink if you're in the area.
author: Linda N.

description: Sucks. Can't tell how many beers on tap. Contradictory signage. Food is pointless. Atmosphere of college bar does not do justice to the beautiful wood paneled walls and plaster ceiling.
author: Michelle M.

description: 0 STARS.  Awful, just awful. staff were terrible. food worse. i had to send it back and leave. absolutely terrible. it is not hard to find staff who actually want to work. our bartender(manager?) was dirty, i mean, she had filth all over her shirt and hands and face. if you were out digging holes, fine, but not serving behind the bar. get it together.
author: ODHRAN M.

description:
We stopped in at Jack's for a few beers on Sunday afternoon recently. There were about 4-6 people at the bar at the time. The bartender attended to us for the first round, but when it came time for a 2nd round, he ran past us at least 6-8 times before my husband was finally able to stop him to ask for another beer. Usual bartenders notice when glasses are empty and pushed forward. We got another round and decided that we'd come back for dinner that night, so we left. We came back that night and there were about 3 tables of people eating dinner. No one was 'hostessing' the front, so we sat ourselves. We waited approx. 15 minutes, the waitress walked past us several times to attend to other tables, she didn't even glance our way. Another waitress pointed us out to her, but still nothing. She continued to chat and socialize with the bartender and other waitresses at the bar. She occasionally would tend to the other diners, but not once did she stop at our table, offer us a menu, wipe our table. Nothing. Finally, after waiting for so long, we got up to leave. My husband stopped her and asked 'What does someone have to do to get service around here??" She looked completely dumbfounded. We walked out and took our business (and money!) elsewhere.
Bottom line? Want a good beer? Jack's is not a bad place. Want a good dinner? Go somewhere else!!!
author: Linda B.

description: i love watching the giants here, and i don't like baseball. hella beers on tap.
author: Matt J.

description: Pros:  85 Beers on tap including Loft (from the makers of Fat Tire), Kronnenberg, and Pyramid Apricot Ale (for the ladies).  Great pub atmosphere.  I've only been when it's been dead.  Not sure if the place ever gets busy.  Bartendars all have awesome accents... Cons:  Bartenders can pour beers, that's about it.  Don't expect to get a good mixed drink here.  They are somewhat grouchy too, because they have to deal with tourists all the time (all tourists aren't bad...just the drunk ones).  Food has something to be desired.  Conclusion:  Go here for beer...that's about it.
author: Chris M.

description:
showing my friends the sights of san francisco includes, of course, the wharf.  full of midwestern, middle aged, mid-calfed pants wearing, mid-day burning women and men.  the crowds, especially on a saturday, can be annoying, to say the least.  
when i first got to san francisco, i loved the wharf. probably for the same reasons many visitors who come to this city do- it's uniquely san francisco.  
but i wonder if it is much like times square.  let me explain.   i used to love times square- even after i moved to nyc.  but then, one day, as i tried to meet a friend on 48th and 7th, i realized i just wanted to push past those slow tourists gawking at the tall buildings.  suddenly i was over times square.  waaaaay over it.  call me rude, but hey, i'm honest.

well, this long and over drawn explanation comes down to this comparison that, also quite honestly, may or may not really have anything to do with my review for jacks cannery.  hey, it's late, i've had two hours of sleep, but what can you do.  

the comparison is this- i still love the wharf for what it is- the piers, the fact that cruises leave from there i still think is cool, and the fact that alcatraz is across the water just says that's neat.  call me an idiot.  wouldn't be the first time.
but to contradict myself, the tourists in the wharf...oy.  those tourists from everywhere.  and they are everywhere.  in your way as you try to cross the street, talking loudly in your ear as you're on the market car...
yeah, i'm over that, too.

the point of all this ramble is that sometimes the touristy stuff there, though uniquely san francisco, is...over the top.  people who wore shorts and tank tops cuz they're in calfornia now wearing san fran sweatshirts everywhere you look can be..almost funny.  but when every place in the wharf seems that over the top touristy feel, we glance up and see some magic words.

"85 beers on tap"

well, on a saturday afternoon, and the outside being not as crowded as i've seen it on the weekend but crowded enough, the bar itself wasn't in bad shape at all.  not too many people, but enough to make you realize this is a place where people who really can't take anymore ridiculousness of psych ward alcatraz sweatshirts come to have a few before joining their friends again in the pirate store down the street.  

and eighty-five beers on tap??  that's commendable.  really.  i'm not kidding.  five different kinds of anchor beer?  ciders?  imported..domestic...they have A LOT  to choose from.

i opted for a random one- the wyders pear cider.  i mean, it was early.  and it was frrrruuuuuity.

i know, it's the wharf.  but you know someone you love is gonna come see you here.  and you know you have to take them to the wharf.  i mean, sea lions.  pirates.  ships.  alcatraz.  gift shops.  you might as well get in something that you'd actually have a decent time at, too.

and the guy playing guitar today was good.  though i laughed at his choices (indigo girls?  are you kidding me?? a dude doing the indigo girls???)  he actually was just the right contridiction to blend in with the circus outside.

next time you're in the wharf, don't skip the cannery bar.  need i repeat this? 
eighty.five.beers.on.tap.
that's cool.
author: Kimberly K.

description:
I really liked this bar. I liked the fact that it's not packed with ppl. The first time we saw it, we just walked by it and saw that they offer $5 breakfast. So the next morning, we remember to go back and get a cheap, fast breakfast. We arrived at about 10 am, there were few people in there having bfast. The food did take a lil longer than IHOP would take, but hey we waited. Our plates were of a good portion.
I also liked the fact that the have sooo many beers on tap. It reminded me of a lil Yard House, without the crowd. I thought it was cool that Mr. Jack had the idea to hang the discontinued taps on the ceiling, pretty cool hall of fame. This place is so, so chill. If you're looking to mingle, meet new people, celebrate your bday here.... Ummm, this is not the place. Mind you, we went in the morning... .I have no idea what the nightlife is like here! There's a lil alley behind Jack's, we walked through there Friday around 7pm, and there was a couple singing live. They were so nice. They sang pretty good too...!

And, yes, it's CASH ONLY! But they do have an ATM on site.
author: Juan H.

description: We always stop at Jacks for a beer when we are walking around Fisherman's Wharf.  Good indoor or outdoor seating, interesting people watching, and a fairly good selection of beer.  I was surprised that they didn't have any Lagunitas, but was satisfied with a good pour of Moylan's Kilt Lifter, and wife had a nice Wheat Ale.  We didn't eat there this time but would if we were not interested in Crabs and Seafood. This is a CASH ONLY bar, so leave your plastic in your pocket.
author: Gadget G.

description: Cool place to hang out. They have a TON of beers on tap (60+ I think) and they have some A-OK food. A little expensive for what it is, but then again, it is located in prime tourist territory.
author: Reid E.

description: This place is cool little spot to stop for beer if you're wandering down by the warf and become a little dehydrated. I believe there are 84 different beers on tap (I only know because it was on the bartenders' shirts), and decently priced ($6.50) which is a plus.   Another plus is the vintage decor; I sat  in the dinning room part of the bar with the funky old wood paneling and huge fire place.  Pretty cool, this place has a lot of history!! I didn't know that Jack's served food but am sure that I would never try it.  It's one of my top five rules in life, "don't eat food from a bar."  Defenitely would come back.
author: Christina D.

description:
This review is for the food service only. 

I was walking along Fisherman's Wharf (I'm a local) one day and saw a banner in front of Jacks proclaiming $6.99 for sirloin steak. Wow, what a deal I thought ,so my Significant Other and I made plans to have dinner there. BIG MISTAKE!!!  We found out when placing our order the price just includes the steak and nothing else. Everything else was ala carte.

I see this as deceptive advertising because one logically assumes when a meal is advertised, it includes some sides. Not here so buyer beware. 

Definitely will not be back when a place advertises their menu in this way.

As for the food, it was ordinary so don't waste your hard earned money eating here. By the time you include all the sides you could have had a much better meal elsewhere for less.
author: John C.

description:
Mind you I'm writing about my lunch experience and not the bar with its fine plethora of brews. Was wandering about SF and doing some touristy stuff with a friend who hasn't before and ended up coming here for breakfast/ lunch. I've been here before and just drank to begin a day of drinking and that was fine but this go around I was having lunch. My two friends ordered two hot dogs each and a burger while I had the steak sandwich. The hot dogs were cold. Not lukewarm, but cold thus negating the hot portion of the name. No bueno. Service was crap with the lady bartender serving us. The food took quite the while to come out and the hot dogs set the tone. The burger was blah and my steak sandwich was pretty plain jane. We left having contemplated seriously dining and ditching but ended up paying. As we left we saw that the outside serving area was a little more bustling with two servers. No one looked all that unhappy. I wonder if things would have been vastly different had we sat outside. This is not a regret more of a point to poor set up. Why would our food be crap just because we decided to eat on the inside?

Anyway. If I come back I'll be boozing only.
author: Don L.

description: 85 beers on tap, including Fat Tire. Enough said.  We went while a cheesy sax player performed outside. Wasn't too busy.  Fun to see German tourists taking a break and enjoying beck's beer (at a place with 85 others on tap, go figure....). Outside bar waiter was friendly and knowledgable.  Drinks not pricey.
author: Beth G.

description: While maybe not the greatest bar ever, Jack's does offer seating in the adjecent court yard, providing a good place to sip one of their 85 bears of tap in the afternoon sun.  Or at least they allege of they 80+ bears on tap, I haven't seen and counted the taps personally.
author: Nick B.

description: Lots of beers on tap, the place is huge and right in the middle of fishermans wharf. Cute photo booth in there too!
author: Mickey Z.

description: If you love whole in the wall dive bars, you've found nirvana. Jacks has the best tap beer selection in SF. You got to check this place out if you like greasy food that will clog your artery washed down with a cold brew. The rude bartender and staff is part of the charm. This is definitely no Clift Hotel Redroom. But Jacks has it's own distinct flavor. No dress code here. Just good old American (and imported) beer!
author: Lan P.

description: I walked in and quickly walked out.  I'm serious.  I thought I was in TGI Fridays.  I gave it a star simply because it seems that they have a lot of beer on tap so if that's your thing go check it out. Included in that star value is the fact that it's been around so long.  I guess that has to count for something right?
author: Amanda P.

description: I know, I know- it's in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. But you'd be surprised how excellent a spot it is in the afternoon.   Slip in here while your relatives are outside, transfixed by the dude covered in silver paint and enjoy your choice of 80-some beers on tap. They also have a fairly good jukebox, a fireplace, tons of comfy seating...and gorgeous wood paneling that was carved for Hearst Castle but ended up here instead.   So-so food.
author: Maureen G.

description: Mass amounts of Beer, a tasty shot called the Otter Pop. Pool table, fireplace,pinball,live music(on occasion),huge booths and table and a kick ass bar tendress(shes got white blonde hair and is a sweetheart) make this place awesome. Block away from the beach. Crowded, but never to the point of uncomfort.
author: Mary B.

description: Ended up here last night as the boy and I wandered about the wharf.  Was drawn in by the sign declaring 68 beers on tap.  Sal was a great bartender and we both properly sloshed by the time we left.  Would definitely come back!
author: Hannah M.

description: What a missed opportunity.  Lovely location in a large brick courtyard with ample outdoor seating.  But Jacks totally missed the boat for ambiance.  I can only review the food and service in the outdoor area.  We were here for a late lunch.  After waiting 5 minutes for a server or anyone to show up, we finally searched for our own menus.  Another 10 minutes a server came outside and I and several other tables tried to get his attention.  No luck.  After another attempt, we were able to order our salads with shrimp, and a couple of beers.  The salad arrived (no bread, no knives) with the lettuce on the bottom, two long stalks of celery, a quartered tomato, a huge thick slice of unpeeled brownish cucumber, and a thick slice of red onion.  On top was a large portion of tasteless shrimp.  All this was piled onto a small plastic plate.    There was no way to get to the greens underneath the mound of shrimp without everything falling off the plate onto the dirty metal table.  With the salad came a tiny paper cup of cocktail sauce and an equally tiny cup of ranch dressing.  Each bite had to be dipped into the sauce, because there was no way to dress the greens and vegetables underneath the pile of shrimp.  The worst part was that I felt the food was old and probably full of invisible yuck.  I couldn't finish it.  After about 20 minutes, two more servers showed up.  They made the rounds asking each table if they were being served.  One of them was dressed in short shorts and black leggings with holes in them.  She was overweight and unkempt;  looking at her was unpleasant.  Good beer served in plastic cups.  Sure this is a touristy area, but this could also be a cash cow with some care and effort.
author: Christine S.

description: we went too jacks for my birthday great beer selection but i got a Stella and it was flat  and it took our waitress long time too come around and get our order  .very poor service  and flat beer makes for a bad experience  :(
author: robert m.

description: Where should I start... the bar is wayyyyyyyyyyyyy too over priced... They dont even give local wharf employees a discount! Such BS! The waitress and bartenders are always so plastered they wouldn't know rum from vodka! I would recommend going to either the Parlor bar and or Fiddlers. staff are way more friendly and the prices are more reasonable.
author: Jenn W.

description: Went here last night with 3 of my friends for some food, we ordered steaks with fries, fish and fries and a blt with fries. Food was served quick and we found everything good and the salad was nice and fresh. Would recommend this place for a good value dinner out.
author: James D.

description: My boyfriend and I were visiting San Fran and went here on our last night. The amount of beers on tap is AMAZING...they even had one of my favorite beers that is extremely hard to find. The beers are a bit more expensive than your average place, but the place has a good vibe, it's huge, and the bartender was great. He was serving the entire bar himself and was fast and friendly....and gave us free Jager on our way out. You can't go wrong!
author: Allison M.

description: pretty nice bar, good outside seating. with 60 some odd beer selections everyone can find one to be happy with. good location on the dock as well so if you want fish afterwards you're in the right place.
author: jason h.

description: the service can be bad, but the bartenders are fun.  and it's great to sit outside when it's a nice day.
author: jen b.

description: This review is solely based on the beer on tap and drink service...and an outside bar.  Any bar that can escape the noise and scene of Fisherman's Wharf is ok by me.  I took some friends from out of town down to the area and we stumbled across this bar.  Great amount of beers on tap, more than ample room to relax with a drink.  I will definitely be back.
author: Matt B.

description: So this bar is the last of the the real one owner chain of Jack's bars here in SF. The place is a fave amongst locals and tourists alike. The bar proudfully boasts it's wide range of draft beers numbering to approx 80 I believe, maybe more but the number could fluctuate. They set the standard of bars here in SF to encumber the most widest range of tap beers in most of the bay area as well. Also keep in kind that they have a full service kitchen with extremely exceptional burgers,fish n chips, and specials that can hit the spot for ya when need be in the hunger department folks. The bartender extraordinaire Tuula, is your answer for awesome mixed drinks with a few you've probably never tried, humor, and unrelentless debauchery when it comes to a down to a good night of swilling. The vibe is very sports bar, and the decor on the ceilings is quite old bcuz the Cannnery has been there since 1907, one year after the big one. So when you are up to having a drinking fest with friends and taste 10 beers that have wacked names, take a trip to Jack's, you'll be back in no time flat for more.
author: Sven S.

description: I have never wrote a yelp review, and never thought about it until today, when I unfortunately went to Jack's bar.  The weather was amazing and my boyfriend and I wanted to enjoy being outside.  We thought we'd get a couple drinks and share something to eat.  We sat down, looked at the menu, and should have left right then and there.  But we ordered a drink, he got a draft beer, which ended up costing $6.50, and I got a glass of the house wine - $7.50.  After looking at the menu for about 20 minutes, we finally chose to share the chicken sandwich.  The server asked if we wanted fries.  We asked if they came with it, and he said no, so we ordered a side of fries.  When our food came out, there were probably about 20 little pieces of old, cold fries, with a few pieces of good looking steak fries mixed in.  We thought it was a joke - asked our server if that was really the side order of fries, and he responded like an idiot.  Then we asked how much the "side" order cost.  $2.75.  Absolutely ridiculous.  They were disgusting.  It was the worst $30 ever spent.  I would never ever go back to this place.  The experience sucked for such a wonderful day.
author: Kristen V.

description: my friend and i stumbled upon this place after failing to find ANY club/bar to go to on halloween. we were 2 of the 3 people wearing costumes in here that night... well, out of like 11 people all together at the bar. haha. sound like an awkward halloween celebration? not at all! the bartenders at the time (a really sweet brazilian girl who JUST started that day named...samantha i think? and an older lady named buffy) hooked us up HELLA MUCH. pint after pint of beer, pear cider, washington apple shots (is that what its called?), shots of some other stuff, taquitos, buffalo wings... and all this for like 20 bucks. forreal. it was just a slow night and we were some of the only patrons in the place, so they really catered to their customers and made us feel so welcome. we listened to journey and enjoyed all the free alcohol for several hours dressed up as a cupcake and a raver. we even met the folks sitting next to us and some dude bought us drinks but then got all creepy so the bartender kicked him out. overall wonderful experience. i'd come back!! there's HELLA beer on tap!!!!!
author: Justine K.

description: my favorite place. paul and sal are the best bartenders EVER.
author: D D.

description: the staff in this bar is great.  they have a beautiful outside area which i didnt realize from sitting in the bar.  sitting wondering why the bartender was busy and just me sitting there once i asked who he was pouring beers in plastiy c cup for he said the outside is packed.  And wow to my shock they have an outside area thats huge.  but you may have to wait because all your beer is comming from one bartender inside.  maybe two at times.  eventually i found out that there is only one cook that cooks for all this outside and inside.  but you dont know that when your waiting inside by yourself for 30 minutes until they tell you.  also  yeah the beer is expensive but remind you it s the norm on the wharf.  and i've been to toranados and i was afraid to ask them about beer and they were so unpleasent and nasty.  at least this jacks staff knows there bere and are not scarey.  yeah maybe thay didnt smile to you.  but have you ever had a bad day?
author: cindy b.
